review: I've been waiting for this place to open ever since they announced it but it was definitely not worth the wait. We got seated rather quickly but after waiting 15 min we had to flag someone down. He was not our waiter but he has the only bright spot in what was a dismal dining experience. He took our order and came back 5 times before our actual waitress even showed up. We got the nacho, steak and shrimp, and steak and ribs. The food took a long time to come out but it was decent, but when we asked for jalapenos we were told there would be an extra charge. Then we asked for steak sauce and were told there would be an extra charge. Might come back for happy hr, but other than that I think we'll be going somewhere else from now on.

For this just opening 5 days ago (my visit was Friday 12/14/12), I couldn't be more impressed! The service was friendly, and the food was pretty bomb. Loved the spinach dip appetizer. Unfortunately, I ordered the potato skins for my meal, and they were poor quality to say the least. There was barely any cheese or bacon on them and the potato was pretty dry! I could have gotten better quality TGIF potato skins in the frozen freezer isle at the local grocery store. :(   I ordered the Ultimate Electric Lemonade which is always perfect at any TGIF's I've been to. (Not the typical watered down alcoholic beverage like most restaurants serve these days) The bf, ordered The Pepper Crusted Pork Chop which he liked and wished that there were two of instead of one. His side of mashed potatoes were reaaaally tasty and moist!!!  But what topped the dinner experience was the Whiskey Cake! TO DIE FOR! and I'm not even a fan of cake!!! It was a warm toffee cake topped with pecans and a Jack Daniels whiskey butterscotch with a side of vanilla ice cream! Yummy!! (I even think I might favor it over my one and only favorite dessert at BJ's... the Pizookie!! (*Gasp*) Our server on this evening still didn't have the menu memorized, and she was pretty forgetful when we asked for waters and certain other items, but I don't knock her for that. (She's still learning!) She was very friendly and quite funny tho. Other servers and managers were constantly stopping to gather dirty plates, offer to refill drinks, and check in on us as they passed our table. There was a 45 minute wait that went relatively quickly. The ambiance of the restaurant is more modern than most TGIF's I've been to in the past, and albeit loud inside... I enjoyed myself. It would be great if they could add more seating inside for people waiting, but overall I enjoyed the evening, and look forward to going back soon!

Regardless of the long wait list. I would come back to this location for a night out with friends. My friends and I went on a Friday night, we called 10 minutes before so we didn't have to wait so long. Still a 20 minute wait when arriving, would of been 40! After finally opening a location closer to 626 area, I recommend that you call before you head over. Environment: The restaurant is a little small, not too cramped but enough for kids to run around. It's clean and welcoming. It's loud but its more of a family/bar area. Customer service: It was GREAT. When arriving to check in at our call, the hostess was very pleasant to double check our names. (They aren't like other restaurants where you call in and when you get there they didn't put your name). Our waitress was really awesome and friendly. Even though the wait is long for the food, our waitress always came by to check up on us. KUDOS to her! Food: The food was so-so. Could be improved. It was completely packed and I suppose it was unexpected for the first Friday. I ordered the Rib-eye steak with lobster. The lobster was ok, steak was a little over cooked and dry. Parmesan fries were AWESOME :) not too much seasoning but just right. Beverages: The drinks took awhile to get to our table, but it was what got us to get started or else we would of gotten antsy about our food orders. There are different types of drinks, so its based on your preference. I got the waitress's favorite, Electric Lemonade. It was okay, but its pretty! Haha Overall: Due to the long wait on getting a table and foods/beverages. Understood that it was a high volume of customers. The customer service overrode it. KUDOS!

You know what's wild about this place? All day happy hour is served all day on SUNDAY --- not FRIDAY. So why would I be thanking god it's Friday brus? Well, I mean I always thank god that it's any day because I love being alive, you know? Positive radiant energy beams and shit. But, honestly, the cheapy boy in me thanks god that it's Sunday whenever I'm feelin' some ULTIMATE Electric lemonades or ULTIMATE Long Islands or ULTIMATE mojitos. I am not sure in the slightest why they are ultimate. Maybe it's because they all have BOMBAY gin? I dunno why I'm ALL CAPSing some things. Sorry, I'll stop. Any way, the above named drinks are 5 bucks. Yeah, I can be informative if I want to be. I obviously came in this past Sunday and loaded up on the happy hour options. I am a frugal filipino after all (no I'm not -- real filipinos would call themselves pinoys or some thing). Copped the $5 boneless wingz which were a decently sweet deal. The mozz sticks and potstickers ain't really worth it tho. I mean, yeah, they're technically appetizers so you shouldn't be expecting mountains of food any way but you literally get six pieces. SIX PIECES. I had to caps for emphasis, fuck it. Basket of fries is okay but it's just a basket of fries. They on the salty side too. Bottled beers are $3.50, I think domestic beers are $3? I got myself an Angry Orchard apple cider because I been on the hard cider tip these last coupla months. I dunno why. It's just so much more drinkable than a regular beer to me (ay don't think me a pussy bru, I drink IPAs and str8 whiskey yaheard --- seriously, I do, but sometimes I just want a dry, sweet cider).  An ironic thing is that the w0rld fam0us potato skins taste worse than the TGI potato skin flavored chips that you can cop from your local grocery store. Seriously. Go try it and compare. Guy Fieri owns this place and so it gets 3 stars. Or so I've heard...

Decided to come here on a Tuesday night after having to work 10+ hours and being extremely hungry.  When we arrived we got seated right away.  The waiter was friendly...took our order.....took OVER 45 MINUTES for the food to come.  and when it finally arrived the FOOD WAS COLD! My steak was room temperature, my broccoli was cold, and lobster was too salty and the only thing hot was my baked potato......For the price i payed for my food i could have gone to HOUSTON s instead.....Would of gotten great HOT food and great QUICK service. NOt only that but when i went to the restroom ...the stalls were so so so tiny.  Im skinny and i even had a hard time getting into one.  The toilet paper holder and toilet was installed so close to the door of the stall that there was such a limited amount of space to enter and exit the stall. Overall, i dont think i would come here again.  The food was decent but i was pretty disappointed with they way how my food was cold and it wasnt only my steak that was cold but so was my friends steak dish.

This is a new location and I was excited to see one open up more closer to the 626 area. Came here during a weekend when it just opened, so I didn't run into any crowd issues as the restaurant was pretty empty.  FOOD QUALITY: For a restaurant that just opened, I'm sorely disappointed by the quality of food here ..    Two things rang in my mind upon the sampler platter: the prized potato skins didn't feel fresh .. as if it was toaster-ovened. On top of that, I was disappointed that the potato skins were piled on top of each other such that the cheese would be touching the neighboring skin.  When my burger came, half of the burger had fallen over and the ingredients were kind of scattered. I would have liked the brioche bun to be toasted to add firmness to the bread while remaining soft, and would have hoped the crispy chicken was actually crispy.. Korean tacos .. did not taste like korean tacos. The bits of meat were gritty and had very loose flavors that did not resemble cooked korean bbq meat. Tortillas weren't good either.. SERVICE: Service was actually nice and polite, just that I thought that they were kind of overstaffed since there were so many floating waiters and waitresses around doing nothing.. causing them to talk with each other for an extended period of time when customers needed things.  ENVIRONMENT: Nice, clean, open, and good positioning of tables in the dining area.  Overall ... The food here is subpar. Period. There is some good flavors but they aren't accompanied with the right textures or presentation. There is nothing in the food here that makes me want to eat here again, especially with the price tag that comes along with it.

Want my review? There's a Del Taco on the other side of the fwy. After waiting for about 30 minutes I asked a passing waiter to please check on our food. Surprise, surprise, he brought it over right away COLD! I guess our server forgot she was on the clock. We ordered simple margaritas on the rocks. Simple right? we ended up sticking with water. Oh, don't trust the menu photos. The clientele? Lets not even go there! Bottom line: Lousy second grade food, bad drinks, TERRIBLE service and OVERPRICED!

Came here one night and liked it so much that i suggest to come back. Which, i now feel stupid for. We waited 2 hours for 10pm to roll around for happy hour. We came and then was informed that happy hour is only in the bar area. We were also informed that everyone had to be 21. We had one person out of 6 that was 20. We asked if we could still be sat at the bar cause our friend who was 20 would not have drank anyways. He was our DD. The waitress had the manager come over and he told us that we could not be sat at the bar even though our friend was not drinking. If that was the case, i dont understand why they restrict happy hour to just the bar. What about the people who would like to enjoy half off appetizers that are not 21?  Rididculous.
We had the sizzling chicken and shrimp and a salmon dish and its pretty dam good. We will definitely come back again.

I ' m glad they opened this restaurant in Rosmead, i went there, the food was great, the steaks delicious and they have Happy Hour all day Sundays,,.one of the best things is the atmosphere is very nice. The prices are kind of expensive, except the 2 for $ 20 dinners including an appetizer. Those are very good dishes , including the shrimp cocktail, I HATE THE NAME OF THE RESTAURANT, because for me every day is Friday, and all days are beautiful.

Cheap nightly happy hour where a "basket" of fries is $1.50! I don't know much about their menu besides the appetizers, so while this place is still new and clean, I wouldn't mind coming back for cheap drinks and half off appetizers.   The sea salt caramel cake is quite good, though a touch dry in the middle.  Service is very friendly.

All 5 stars go to the burgers. Oh..the alhambra/rosemead/monterey park area desperately need some good American food restaurants. Thanks for opening one here.  Came here twice in the last month. First time I ordered a chicken pasta, which was dry and not that tasty. I barely touched it.Took the whole thing home. My gf ordered the cheesy shrimp, which she said was too cheesy. Well maybe it's best for someone who is crazy about cheese. This was only a 3 star experience.  Came here again on XMAS day cuz everybody else decent was closed. My bf and I ordered the Spicy Craft Beer-Cheese Burger* and the jack daniel's burger. Both are juicy, fresh,and absolutely DELICIOUS!! I think the Jack Daniel's Burger has become my new fav burger replacing Red Robin's bonsai burger. I loved it! My bf also thoroughly enjoyed his spicy burger and that's saying a lot because I can't remember the last time he was happy with his burger. Our server was very genuinely nice and attentive. We left her a very nice tip. (Yes people leave some extra on a holiday, please. ) Oh..both times I ordered hot water with lemon and honey. It tastes awesome(especially if you have a cold or sore throat) and it's FREE. I don't drink sodas and iced water just seems too cold sometimes. Now I've found a great alternative.

Ivanna was amazing if u come over here ask for her....had a great time with her great service......our drinks on time my food hot n fresh and she had a nice conversation with us...made feel apreciated....tanx a lot ivanna

Yay, more excitement to the Rosemead Plaza -- especially with this edition. Parking here is extremely easy, no need to stress or fret. Food was alright-- nothing too spectacular nor was it the worse, just because I'm not a super fan of American food. However, there is always good deals here. Well, a lot -- like the 2 for $20 deal. Service was SPECTACULAR. This probably the reason for the five stars, (and extra tips when I was dinning). Our blonde latina waitress was extremely friendly, along with her helpful suggestions on what to get and what not to get. I absolutely loved her, and the rest of the friendly staff. Overall, this wasn't my cup of tea, based upon my personal preference. However, the service and staff here were wonderful. And if I have a friend who is ever in the mood for American food, I'd totally take them here. Or if I just want a nice alcoholic buzz, since I do live nearby ;). I'm sure I'll see more of TGI Friday's soon. Turn Ons: - GREAT SERVICE.

My co-workers and I wanted to go out for lunch since it's the first Friday of the year. One co-worker told me that we all enjoyed TGI Fridays and he advised us a new location open in Rosemead. We've been to a location in Covina and we all enjoyed it, so we assumed it would be a good experience. What ended up happening was the following: warm/cold food that has obviously been waiting for a long time, slow service from our waiter (Cory) and long wait times from getting our food and any additional time that we asked from our water.  Yes, our waiter did apologize for the long wait times, but the slow service and the quality of the food could seriously be improved.  My co-workers and I left the restaurant with barely a smile and slightly full stomach. A tip was barely visible on the table when we left.  The management and corporate employees needs to take a seriously look at the new TGI Fridays location in Rosemead. There is a lot that needs to be improved as for customer service, quality of food and wait times.

My first two experiences coming here, the waitresses would forget what we asked for sometimes. My family believed that maybe it was because we came right after the rush hours ended so the workers were tired. The food was alright.  Normally, I don't write reviews unless I find something really great to talk about. By the third time we came again, the food was still the same. However, I must mention the great service of our waiter, Ricardo. I've eaten at many restaurants, and I just have to say--Ricardo is manager material (and that's not an exaggeration)! He checked up with us often, asking if we needed anything. A lot of things happened where TGIF did make us unhappy at some moments, but Ricardo always made sure to make up for it. We made sure to give him a good tip :) I hope TGIF gets name tags for their waiters/waitresses soon, it's a shame if, in the future, I'd like to point out another good person but not know their name :(
So happy that we have a TGIFriday in Rosemead. The service was great.  The vibe at the restaurant was good. The bar area is really nice. Def. will go back

food came out at a good time, the jack daniel wings are sooo good... the drinks come out pretty fast,  the only thing is, i know its a new place however i would like the servers to know what they are talking about i normally ask what i should get drink and food and if you say it is the best long island, then i expect it to be the best... it was just too sweet to drink seating is pretty quick and i like how it is next to target! parking is really easy as well

Great addition to Rosemead.  They need more bars in the area. It's a big restaurant, but i think it's a bit crowed when it's busy. My waitress was nice but a bit slow. But I'll give them a break, since they just opened.  I'll be back in a few months when they are more established.

It's corporate, I know...why come here? Sometimes I like structure, sometimes I like consistency.  Corporations STRIVE on structure and consistency! Now, this review has NOTHING to do with their food! I don't come here for food! I come here for their happy hour drink specials, which I think, are pretty damn good. Their happy hour is pretty legit. Half off appetizers and very good drinks specials. Pair that with the best HH hours, in the biz. They've got HH everyday of the week, including, ALL DAY on Sundays! This location is new, their decor is new, I've never seen this look in any other TGIF. It's simple, but nice, the bar area especially. The bar tenders are very attentive, which I appreciate. Again, this rating is strictly for their Happy Hour at their bar! Food: N/A Ambience: 4 Service: 4 Value: 4

Second time here. Thought I have them a try again. Big mistake! My friend and I order steak. Both medium rare. One steak was right and the second one is medium well. Had it remade. Took forever to get to us. Had to ask about our appetizer cause that didn't come out either. Appetizer finally came out and my entree is still not here. by now my friend's food is cold and we still can't eat. Staffs are new and not very well organized.

*** Review is only for Happy Hour Specials *** Great local bar and friendly bartenders. Half off appetizers, $4 well drinks, cheap beer, and a dangerous $1.50 basket of fries (which we usually end up getting two). The Ultimate Electric Lemonade, Ultimate Long Island Iced Tea, and Ultimate Margarita were ultimately really sweet. Not recommended unless you have a sweet tooth.

Took my mom here today and we had a pretty good lunch. Staff was friendly; our waiter Christian was very nice and attentive. Food took a while but arrived warm which was perfect for me. I ordered the pepper-crusted pork chop with jasmine rice for my mom and she liked it (she's usually very picky). I had some kind of chicken pasta and it was okay, not fantastic, but nothing a little tabasco couldn't fix. Overall, it was good. I'd probably come back to try the Jack Daniel ribs.

I came here for an office dinner so we had a pretty big group. They were more than accommodating although they made us wait for at least half the party to arrive before seating us. While waiting, we had happy hour drinks and food at the bar which they kindly moved to our table once we sat down. The HH appetizers are good and worth the visit, but the TGIF's menu is uninspiring. I really couldn't decide on what to eat-- there are a lot of options and combos which made it a bit confusing.  I ended up getting a steak & ribs plate with a size of tomato & mozzarella salad and sweet potato fries. I asked for the steak medium rare, and I kid you not... it came out well done!! I'm not the type to send back my food because god knows what people do to food sent back to the kitchen -_- .... I ate it anyways because it at least tasted okay.... it's that darn Jack Daniel's sauce. Sickingly sweet sauce that tricks your tastebuds into liking everything! A few people in our group ordered lobster tails and the server came back to inform us they were out of lobster tails. As a chain restaurant, I think it's pretty bad to be out of something listed on your menu. Definitely room for improvement in terms of service too. You can tell the servers are new because there were a lot of "i'm not sure, let me find out for you" responses and our waitress kept mistaking me for the person sitting next to me and tried to make conversation by asking me a weird question about our ethnicitiy. I'll let it slide.. girl's new to the job and I hope she gets better with experience.
Gave it a second and third try and yes there was a great improvement. Waiters still need a bit more experience. But can't complain about "Happy Hour".

Not very happy with this TGIF Fridays in Rosemead! We waited over an hour for our food and when we got it they had all our orders wrong. Even tho they made the mistake we still waited 20 mins to get our order corrected. So I would not Recommend to go to this one at all!

So glad they opened up another location but I think the services at this location isn't quite there yet. I love their sizzling Chicken and Cheese and when I go to the West Covina Location it comes out SIZZLING but the Rosemead location comes out not sizzling - a total party pooper...Either the services is too slow or they just don't know that its suppose to sizzle when it comes out. Services right now is a bit slow, looks like all the servers are in training and can't seem to remember anything you tell them but hey i love TGIF so I continue to come back. I think the best part about this location is they have Michael and Liana from the West Covina location working in the Bar again... Thank goodness! This TGIF would be horrible if the bar tenders were as slow as the waiters. If you want a fun Bar experience, just wait till Michael is Bartending. Happy Hour is awesome!

Maybe because this place is brand new the service is still on the slow/unorganized side.  I waited at the bar for at least 5 minutes to get a drink. Now normally five minutes is not bad, but there was no one else waiting and like 3 bartenders behind the bar.  The bar is huge by the way too.  Food was typical chain restaurant American fare, the waiters were very polite and friendly, and the atmosphere is loud with a mix of families and the drinking age crowd who like to "party" at TGIF's.  I was there with a group, so I didn't pick the place, and if I go back it will probably be under these circumstances too as I'm not really the TGIF type.  Hopefully their service improves and gets more streamlined.
Love their happy hour appetizers. Great promotion system. Great atmosphere. Great service. Absolutely 5 star dining.

The 2 for $20 is kinda on the weak side, so I had the sizzling chicken and mashed potato platter.  The chicken was juicy, potatoes were amazing, and the mixed veggies complimented the meal very nicely.  However, I think this place is kinda overpriced, but other than that  this restaurant is pretty good.   Bar looks fully loaded. Enjoy :]

only one star due to 5minutes before entering power went out for about an hour..no complementary for next visit and no apologize from manager did not see the hole time when power went out to apologize for the convenience for all the customers that were there

This is my first time try out T.G.I Friday's and I am impressed. I've only heard mediocre things about T.G.I but my mind is made up. It's a great and delicious place to eat.  After arriving, there was groups of people wait for tables. After putting down my name they asked for my phone number so that I can get notified via text when my table was ready. My first thought was such an amazingly techy place. I was able to walk around the plaza to look around before my table was called.  For the times I went, I tried the Cajun Shrimp Pasta, Baby Back Ribs, Skillet Garlic Shrimp. 2/3 of the items were good. The Cajun shrimp was as delicious as it looked. I highly recommend getting it if you want to stuff your face in pasta. My second choice is the Skillet Garlic Shrimp, which was filled with cheesy goodness that satisfied my appetite. As you can guess, the Baby Back Ribs were horribly dry and did not taste that great.  Overall, the food was good and service was okay. Nothing to complain about. I can see myself coming to this place once in a while when I'm craving some creamy food.

Not too shabby!! I live around the corner from this location, and they are always still  open by the time i get off work (by that time it's always happy hour)  hoorayy! Off the numerous times that i've been there, we've only received less than mediocre service once. (and ironically while i was in the company of a friend who claims they've never experience good customer service there! haha.) On my last visit, we were taken cared of by a gentlemen named Ryan, he was very courteous and accommodating, and  made sure to check up  on us for seconds all without being too pushy. (which i appreciate.) The one thing i would NOT recommend there is their buffalo chicken wings! They are SO. SALTY. geesus. I was told that the garlic parmesan was worst.. i could only imagine.   I usually like to order their spinach flatbread, their loaded potato skins, loaded nacho skillets, and their red velvet cake. (Which surprisingly tastes very buttery and non too dry.) I think this place one up Applebees down the street by their modern interior, courteous staff, and convenient location. It's right off the freeway after all. Ohh, and if you're a stripped club member, you get free chips and salsa upon arrival!

Came here last month with my family to celebrate my birthday. ohmygawd terrible service. We all ordered the steak with ribs. We waited a fairly long time approx. 20 for our food, but we were fine with it. However, what I wasn't happy with was that once everyone in my table received their food, the server tells my boyfriend really late that they ran out of sirloin steak and are trying to get more. Then she later offered a complimentary chip and dip. Also she didn't even wait him to order thing else and asked if he could wait for it. Later she lied and said she's going on break but ended up having the assistant manager "take care" of us while she was working the other tables.  By the time his steak came (45 minutes later!!), everyone was done with their food and wanted to leave. Of course I called the manager if he could give a discount on his steak only because it was really unfair for him to eat alone while everyone is done. Apparently the manager wasn't in the office and I could tell the assistant manager didn't really want to give a discount but ended up doing so and took roughly 6 dollars off, which was fine. However he billed us for the free chip and dip. He took forever changing the bill and once he gave me the new bill, he looked me in the eye and told me "Do not take the tip out on my waiters". WTF?! Poor customer service and still wants me to tip well. Oh man... Food was mehh. Probably because I was heated most of the time. Please do not waste your time going for mediocre service and food.

I have been to this TGIF's twice since it first opened late last year '12.  The food here is decent both times that I was here.  The first time we sat in the bar area for Happy Hour so we could watch the Lakers game while we chow down our food.  For Happy Hour, the specials is only served in the bar area.  The prices are not that expensive... so we ordered sliders, beef nachos, onion rings, buffalo wings, beer, and an Ultimate Electric Lemonade which was a lemon margarita with that fancy name.  The food came out after about 15 minutes which was a decent time. Everything was cooked nicely, and well presented.  The food  was full of flavor, and my favorite was the buffalo wings... simply because of the spicy kick it has in it.  The sliders were tiny but delicious with the meat cooked at medium well. The nachos and onion rings were just there to snack on, so it doesn't really matter.  The Ultimate Electric Lemonade was well mixed.  It's not that strong in terms of the alcohol content, and you could really taste the tangy lemon flavor with it's glass rim dipped in sugar.  I think I drank a couple of those lemonades because it was so good. So the first time, I was happy and pleasantly surprised.  The second time I went was totally a different story.  The waiters and waitresses was still very friendly.  The hostess on the other hand wanted to seat us on a table in the bar facing nothing but a dark corner.  I didn't think she was too bright or posses enough common sense  to do that because there was plenty of tables around the windows, and a few other empty tables around the bar.  I was with my parents who are older, and I am sure they won't want to sit in the bar!  Especially when it was a beautiful day.  I refused that table so she finally sat us in a more desirable location. Yes, everybody working there was very friendly and courteous to the customers.  Our waiter was probably still new.  I figured just by looking at him that he's still learning his position.  So I excused him for not being able to perform perfectly... especially when his cell phone went on.  But he was very respectful to my parents and he tried to be professional too. We started off with drinks.  Two raspberry iced teas and a coca cola.  No problem, he brought it over to us instantly.  He took our orders, and great... we could eat soon.  Guess what? our food did not arrive at our table until 45 minutes later.  The restaurant was well staffed, it was no longer that busy since the rush ended, but no food?!? The other people who sat down after us was already eating.   I was so irritated because of what happened.  I asked the waiter, and another waiter who wasn't the one serving us to check.  They finally brought out my order of Spinach Florentine... which is flat bread with cheese and spinach dip on top.  It was good though!  We waited again for another 10 minutes and the food finally came out.  An order of chicken pasta, an order of spaghetti, and my Jack Daniels Burger.  I must say the food was still very good! My burger was flavorful cooked medium, and JD sauce was served on the side.  The pasta dishes was also delicious.  The spaghetti sauce and white cream sauce went well with the pasta.  I think I will order that the next time I go. Anyhow, going back to the 45 minutes wait.  I was not happy.  I had to reschedule another appointment I had later the afternoon because of our long wait.  It was funny how the manager came out... per my request since the waiter asked if I wanted to talk to her.  Each of the waiters couldn't really explain why the food took so long.  The only said the cook in the back go sick and left without telling anybody.  So of course the manager had to say the same thing to keep the story consistent.   For me... I could careless what happens in the back kitchen, or who's (the employee) dysfunctional.  It is an internal problem that needs to be fixed quickly.  More importantly it happened on a Saturday.  I could just imagine the 45 minutes wait during a lunch hour on a weekday.  How can anybody explain the matter about being late going back to the office?   So please TGIF... take care of your internal problems.  This is not a good way to sustain your business even though it's so nicely remodeled inside.  Sure anybody could make up any excuse about the food part. Oh yeah, we ended up getting a free lunch from the manager.  But I felt bad for the waiter who really tried to serve us. So at least I still left a tip!  A weak 3 stars now because of my experience of their bad hair day.   But I will be back again... and hopefully it will be a better experience.  Especially if it is a business meeting lunch.

Fail after Fail... I took my friend to her birthday dinner and a couple of coworkers also joined, When we were seated the waiter took our drink orders which surprisingly took forever, They were still very delicious.  Fail#1 : We all received our orders wrong and one at a time, I returned my hamburger which was done with cheese and I said no cheese because I'm lactose, And the birthday girl ordered nachos  without  jalapenos and she got them all covered with jalapeños.  Fail#2 I went out to the front to tell them if they could have the waiters sing happy birthday to my friend, The host asked me who is your waitress And I told her the name which I wasn't pronouncing it correctly, So she said oh the "black" one! I said to myself wow that was racist. they came and they sang happy birthday and brought my friend Sunday Fail#3 After midnight it was coincidentally my birthday, And I was surprised With the one waitress coming and handed me a Sunday and saying I'm sorry but all the waiters left and they cannot sing happy birthday anymore, I looked at her and said well thank you I guess But my friend was Very upset because she told them to see me happy birthday. Fail#4 : 10 minutes later they sang happy birthday to a table across the bar, Then another 10 minutes passed by and they sang happy  birthday again to another table. My friend was so annoyed .  Fail#5 my whole Sunday Melted because they forgot that my friend told them not to bring me a Sunday instead to bring me a brownie because I am lactose . Fail#6 We were tired and now it was my birthday so we decided to go somewhere else we asked for the bill which took 10 minutes to get it and we were all charged wrong twice they came in twice they take the receipt back Because we were charged for other people's food.  At the end we all just ended up leaving a bit unpleased with the service  Ps when they picked up my melted Sunday the waiter wasn't paying attention and he dripped it allllll the way to the kitchen in the back , n had to out caution cones

Came here on a Friday night for happy hour. There was a Laker game that night so of course, this location was packed. The 45 minute wait didn't seem too bad though since there were plenty of televisions to watch while waiting for my table and with the overtime and whatnot, my friends wanted to stay and finish watching the game anyway instead of searching for a less crowded place to eat. Less than 45 minutes later, I got a text to let me know the table was ready and was led to a booth right in front of the tv. Yay!  Happy hour (after 10pm til closing) gives you the opportunity to get 50% off appetizers  (smaller portioned but it's half the price so that's expected), $5 and under drinks ranging from margaritas to beer, and of course the rest of the menu is still available. The service was good and for the amount of drinks and food we had, the number on the bill looked like a miracle lol. Happy hour guys - it's worth the wait!

Ok place, not like the TGI Fridays I've been to in the San Fernando Valley. We went in on a Sunday night at 8pm and the place was packed. I looked forward to a great meal since  there were so many people, but I was not impressed.  I came with my two kids, one who needs a high chair. When I spoke with the hostess I said, 4 people, as I was holding my little one year old. She put us down and said it would take 30-40 minutes. Ok, no problem. After waiting about 30-40 minutes we were walked over to our table. It was a booth without the ability to have a high chair. Great. So I was offered to wait for another table or take this table and they could give me a booster. I chose to get a booster. Then our waitress comes, takes our drink orders, one was a kids chocolate milk. Then another waitress comes, says she's our waitress and asks us for our drink order. We explained someone already helped us and the previous waitress comes up. They start going into some lame comedic routine about tables and competing and their laughing and smiling. I wasn't smiling. I felt like saying, "shut up and get our order, I don't care who had the table, just take our order and go away."  Anyway - out comes one of our mixed drinks and two sodas but no chocolate milk. According to the waitress the bartender has to mix the chocolate milk so it takes time. Really? Seriously? You can make a freaking mixed cocktail but you can't make a chocolate milk? What a joke.  In conclusion our food was ok, not great. I ordered the Jack Daniels grilled chicken plate with steamed broccoli and sweet potato fries. Nothing spectacular for the cost. My daughter, the older one - not the one year old, mentions to our new waiter (did I mention the previous waitress came up and told us she was going on break? whatever) that it's my birthday. The waiter smiles and later comes out with two scoops of ice cream and says, "here, for your birthday" My daughter was so disappointed, she wanted the singing and clapping, nope, didn't get it. I won't drive out of my way to come here, I live in the SF valley so I have no interest in going back.

Ok I have come to this TGI Friday's a few times already, and each time I have hoped that the service/ food would get better. 3 out of the 4 times that I have gone, the experience has definitely been undesirable for me to consider coming back. I understand that on the weekends the place gets crowded and everyone wants to join in. I feel that this specific branch lacks in a timely matter of serving food. The servers have definitely tried to make the experience better by advising the status of the food prep. I think at the end of the day, they either need more help in preparing food from the kitchen or a new plan in terms of serving food faster. All and all the food is mediocre, but their drinks are good for the most part. ENJOY!
4 stars for late night happy hours Mon-Sat and ALL DAY WHOLE RESTAURANT HAPPY HOUR SUNDAY! No more fighting for bar tables! Food and drinks taste better when they're cheaper. :D
Place is cool, bar has a good ambiance.. Go Lakers!

Good place to come for Happy Hour!!! Happy hour is from i think 4-7pm? and then 10 pm - closing. Appetizers are 50% off!! good deal!!! Sliders are 1.50 each!!!  BUT! according to the waitresses, you can only get these happy hour prices at the bar area. It does get crowded late nights .. so come early? oh! $1.50 for a basket of fries to munch on while catching up with your friends!! All of their appetizers are decent.. I like the potato skins with cheese and bacon appetizer dish.. SOOO GOOD.. Their BIG GINORMOUS Margaritas are $5.00.. good deal!! I also had their Washington Apple cocktail drink.. tastes pretty darn good too.. will come back in the near future for HH. Parking is absolutely not a problem.. many parking spaces.... OH! and if you do get all tipsy and buzzed from the Happy-houring.. u can also hop over to IHOP (right by there) to sober up and have some pancakes to sober up?.. mmmmm

BLEHHHH... I seriously doubt I will ever come to this location again. I brought my little brothers here to try the happy hour specials since they've never come before. We were greeted by 4 overly eager hosts/hostesses/ barbacks/whatever the hell they were. That was seriously.. AWKWARD. We were then seated and asked for a round of waters. It took our waitress.. wait for it.. TWENTY MINUTES to come back with our waters. Which was completely fine, since we needed time to look oever the menu anyway. Except.. she didn't take our orders. She brought us our waters and rushed off to a table that just got seated. She took their drink orders, came back with their drinks, took their orders, took another table's drink orders, AND THEN came back to take our order - ____-" I would have seriously just walked out if my little brothers weren't so excited to try the food. We decided to just order a bunch of apps since they were all 1/2 off for happy hour. Our food: - Garlic Parmesan Wings with Ranch: Mehh.. These really didn't have too much flavor at all. They literally tasted like chicken. Which isn't a bad thing.. I guess.. - Scorching Hot Wings with Bleu Cheese: These were my favorite. I'm a HUGE fan of heat, and although these weren't atomic, they passed the heat test (; Paired alongside the bleu cheese, these were to die for ! - Caribbean Rum Wings with Ranch: These were REALLY SWEET. My little brothers thought they tasted like apple pie because of the cinnamon that was in them. LOLL I don't know if I would ever order these again. - Nachos Grande: These weren't too bad. I wish there was more cheese on these because the chips felt a little dry. But the flavor of the cheese sauce and chicken were pretty darn delicious. It came with one heaping scoop of guac and sour cream. Pretty awesome. All in all, I like TGIF. Just not this particular one, with the server who neglected us for long periods of time. It took us THIRTY MINUTES to get our waters refilled ! I had to flg down another server to do it, and all she did was get my original server, who took her sweet as time to get me my water. GRRRRR. How do I eat my food if my mouth is in dire need of hydration ?! Can anyone do this ?!

The first time I went to a T.G.I. Friday's was years ago, five or so, and it was to the one in West Covina. Seeing this place recently opened and having a bunch of coupons, we decided to try this location. On a Saturday night, parking was hassle free and the wait was approximately 25 minutes. We didn't want to wait so we decided to sit in the bar area, which included not only the actual bar counter, but also the high-top tables and stools surrounding the bar. While we mulled over the menu, I heard someone greet us, "Hey girls!" and I quickly replied "hi" thinking it was our server. Looking up, it dawned on me this wasn't our server, as this person was a large middle-aged man, wearing a green athletic v-neck. The three of us -- my mom, sister, and I -- stared at him in silence as he creepily smiled at us, then told my sister that she shouldn't be wearing earbuds and listening to music as she's in the company of friends. We continued to stare in silence. He smiled again and made his way back to his table, right next to us. His family (?), a woman and a little boy, didn't notice a thing. It was so weird. Over the course of our meal, he would stare at my sister and smile at her. Before he and his family left, he came over to tell my mom what beautiful daughters she had. SO WEIRD. Now that I'm done ranting, I can start on the food. T.G.I.F.'s menu is quite extensive, and we decided to get two mains and a dessert to share. Salmon Langostino ($18.99) This tasty dish consisted of Norwegian salmon filet fire-grilled and topped with a sauté of langostino lobster and cremini mushrooms in a zesty roasted Alfredo sauce. We went with broccoli and baked potato as our sides. The baked potato was very large, which my mom enjoyed tremendously. Lobster Tails ($24.99) Two 4 oz. lobsters seemed like a really awesome deal but they were tiiiiiny. My mom had the steamed one and said it wasn't fresh and didn't like the random seasoning they put on it. However, mine was grilled, fresh, and tasty. Freshness and quality wasn't consistent, so I'm not sure if I'd ever order this again. For our sides, we chose another baked potato and tomato mozzarella salad, which was very fresh and appetizing. Ultimate Strawberry Shortcake ($5.99) Okay. So one of my favorite desserts is the Strawberry Shortcake from Dairy Queen, but they stopped making it at the location nearest me. It's been a couple of years and every so often, I get huge cravings for it, only to be met with sadness and disappointment that I can't get it anymore. Seeing this particular dessert on T.G.I.F's menu was such a beautiful moment for me because it's almost the exact same thing as DQ: pound cake, vanilla ice cream, and strawberry syrup. It was also huuuuge, served in a giant cocktail glass, and consisted of 3-4 ice cream scoops -- perfect to share among 3 girls. With our 25% off coupon, the total came to $41, including tax. The food is a bit tastier than standard American chain fare but a bit overpriced. I'd only come again if I had another coupon or during happy hour. Or if I'm ever craving that wonderful strawberry shortcake dessert again!

Great servers and customer service - they are attentive and friendly. Happy hour specials on 1/2 off drinks and food are only applicable when seating in the bar area. Advertisement does not specify this, found out after we ordered :/ gotta love their sliders and mozzarella sticks!

Believe it or not, this is my first time to TGIF. So i was excited to give this place a try since we go to Cheese Cake Factory all the time with my teenagers. We ordered the chicken and shrimp Cajun pasta (3stars), Dragon chicken (3 stars), cheese Berger (3 stars), and the brochette pasta (2 stars), We ordered the cheese with spinach flat bread (awful! no stars! the bread was very dry and brittle. it wasn't crispy or soft! the mozzarella is 3 stars. Over all, it was OK. price is cheaper than cheese cake but the portion is smaller

Guess what my friend found in her food? A STAPLE...  seriously, no lie. The manager compensated with her half eaten dish on the house and a dessert. So.. if you want your insides cut up and ripped out by a staple making its way through your system, this is where you want to go.

I've only been to T.G.I Friday's twice and the first time was a long time ago. The second time reminded me why I never came back. I don't understand how anyone can come here and feel that it's worth it. The food in my opinion, is overpriced for the portion. It's really small and isn't that great. Both times I've been here I haven't been full and left still hungry. The steak here is the worst thing I've ever had. I asked for medium rare and it came out well-done. The meat is dry and tasteless. The wings here are decent, but one order of it is barely anything and makes it just not worth ordering. Hopefully I learn my lesson after the second time and remember not to come here again.

Nice to finally have a bar/grill in the city of Rosemead that stays open late. Decided to stop in for a late dinner. Ordered the Jack Daniels rib eye steak. Food took about 30 min to come out. I asked for medium n got well done. The bartender was cool and offered to have the kitchen make another one, but said it'd take another 20 min at least.  Place is brand new n clean and overall the service was good.  Kitchen just needs a lil more training....

SLOW SERVICE! The stars are for the waitresses only. They had excellent personalities and tried their best to be accommodating, even though the bartenders and cooks were lousy. We had a large party and, as expected, they could not accommodate us for nearly 1.5 hours. We sat in the bar area and ordered drinks while we waited. I have to say these bartenders have got to be the SLOWEST bartenders on the face of this earth! The bar wasn't that crowded and it took nearly 10-15 minutes for them to serve 2 beers. They don't look at you, they don't acknowledge you, and they move at a snails pace. Very poor customer service at the bar! When we finally sat down to eat we waited nearly 30 mins for our food to arrive. My mother's plate had rice that was stone cold. We asked for another order of rice, but instead they gave her a whole new plate (which we didn't ask for) and charged us for it. It's not a gourment restaurant, so why are they working at a pace as if they are??? Had to speak with the manager to make these adjustments, which he did, after much discussion and complaining about the service. Please train your bartenders and cooks on efficiency, speed and accuracy!!

I have only been to this new location twice and the first time was not great.  I ordered a drink along with the people that I was there with but for some reason theirs was brought out but not mine. Okay no biggie, I just sipped from my bf and thought mine will come after but I should have realized that strawberry lemonade should not take longer than an electric lemonade.  Then I guess the server messed up orders and brought us another table's appetizer, it was what we had ordered and we thought it was weird that it came out so fast and we even said so but he put down the food anyways.  Our waitress realized his mistake after and came to our table to tell us: "You guys knew that was wrong."  Rude, don't blame us for your servers' mistakes.  I brushed it off because everyone else was like yeah we thought so, we haven't touched it take it back blah blah.  So I finally had the chance to ask for my drink again, and she asked what I had ordered so I said strawberry lemonade and my friends ordered more drinks for themselves.  She quickly comes back with "my drink" which is now a lemonade, not gonna push such a little thing so much so I drank it without telling her anything.  I should have just ordered water. My last experience with them was much better, I recently went again for a friend's birthday and it was 12 of us in the bar area at a round table, they need to get bigger tables in the bar area but they did great with accommodating us.  We had no issues with our server, no messing up of orders and our drinks kept coming quickly.  This time I was happy that there's a new Friday's closer to home.   Happy hour is Mondays to Saturdays in the bar area only 3 to 7 I think then 10 to closing BUT on Sundays it's all day in the bar and dining area, I know when I'm going again :)

I went here during my lunch break. I often go to sit down restaurants on my lunch break and have plenty of time to spare. This was not the case here. My friend and I placed our order as soon as the waiter came to the table to greet us. I let the waiter know we were on a lunch break. He came over three times to tell us our food would be right out. Twenty minutes later our food finally came out. My steak was over done and overall I was disappointed with the food. I may go back for happy hour when time is not a concern, but this will definitely not be a place I frequent again for lunch.

I don't get what all the hype is about. When this place first opened everyone within my social sphere was like ERMMMAHHGERDDD TGIF YUSSSS (that's how their voices sound in my mind). So I went to finally try it and... flop. Happy hour is confined within this teeny bar space, which is always ALWAYS crowded. You can't sit all the other empty tables OUTSIDE of the tiny parameters of their bar, else your happy hour special is void. I'm not much of a beer person, and their selection of drinks (for happy hour) isn't that great.  I ordered the buffalo wings appetizer because.. how can you go wrong with spicy buffalo wings? Yuck. It was more sour than spicy, and the chicken mostly just felt like fat. The ranch didn't even stick. Think Denny's buffalo wings - also yuck. I've given this place a second and third try, and it's just not for me. Lame. I'd much rather go to Cheers or Rabbit Hole. Or Gyu. Geez.

Came here for dinner on a Sunday and were seated promptly. Ordered the appetizer + 2 entrees special. We waited quite a while for the food to be served, while the server came to us several times saying our food will be out shortly. We had the flatbread which was good, if you like a lot of cheese. We had a pasta dish with chicken that was surpringly tender and moist, but the pasta had too much chili oil and another chicken dish with rice which was quite spicy, but good. I got full from eating the appetizer and ate only 1/3 of my entree and took the rest to go since I was pressed for time. Food and service is alright and plentiful parking.
This place has a great happy hour... Even on weekends.. So plan accordingly.

Horrible food and service. Asked for medium rare ribeye and they brought it well done. Took 25 minutes for the server to ask us what we wanted to drink and another 20 minutes for is to find the server to bring us the check. At 4pm with downtime, the table next to us ( which was empty when we got here)  still wasn't cleaned. I understand the location is new but staff should not be put on the floor unless they were trained to be at least attentive. For the service plus the ridiculous price for the less than mediocre food, I will not be back.

Never gave T.G.I.friday's a chance. Until now..and Thank god one opened nearby. If your a cheap date like me, you will love love love Happy hour here.  Happy hour menu!! Ultimate margaritas Long Island  Mmmm...BEER Ribs and wings Pretzel sticks w/cheese dip spinach and cheese flatbread All = Damn good Friday! Cons: Happy hour is only offered in the bar area..LAME.

This is a newer location that I would visit again.  Friendly and welcoming staff.  Prices are as expected for this type of establishment.  I really liked the layout of this location.  Food took a bit longer than expected but that's OK.  Plenty of free parking in their lot, which is shared with other retail stores. This is a great addition to this part of Rosemead.

Went today because the all day Sunday Happy Hour included the Dining room area. Half off the appetizers was cool   It was okay nothing special, the Salmon was dry and overcooked, waited and waited for my margarita which came half way into my entree.  Our server was nice, but the majority of the staff looked like they had a stick up there a**

I encountered a TGIF staff who stole my parking space. I was waiting for the parked car to back out when suddenly this car just drove into it and parked! I was the first  and ONLY car in full view waiting for that space at that time.  I honked my horn to let the intruder know that the space was mine.  She just looked at me and as I was looking for another space, she ran into TGIF. She was wearing black and is one of the staff. I believe she is one of the hostesses. She vanished when I went in the restaurant looking for her. But, I still decided to give the restaurant a try. Dinner was supposed to be enjoyable, but sadly, she put me in a bad mood. My friends recognized her on our way out. But, at that point, I just wanted to get out of there.  First of all, people should have manners! We do not live in a primeval world.  TGIF needs to hire people who are not only good at customer service but who have manners!  People who are rude shouldn't be working in the service industry.

I have only stopped in for a beer at happy hour.  Drink discounts and half priced appetizers, but as I said, I've only had a beer so I can't tell you anything about the food.  Widmer IPA. Goose Island IPA.  Not a wide selection of beers, but as long as they have an IPA, I can't complain.

I've never been to Tgif before and when one popped up in Rosemead I decide to check it out. The food is nothing to brag about and it was not exactly cheap too. I'd would rather drive further to go to Claim Jumper. The service was ok. I do like the rewards program!

I have been here twice since it opened and the waiters can be hit or miss. The first time, the waiters were on top of it and made sure our food came out quickly and that we always had refills for our drinks. The second time, maybe because it had been open a little longer, the waitress was just a little too laid back. I always need about 3 or 4 refills (which I know is a little excessive) but she never even noticed after my first cup went empty. Other than that though, the food was great.

I agree with the 3 star rating.  I've been here twice.  It's mediocre food and service. I ordered Jack Daniels flat iron steak. Medium was a little more than medium. The tomato mozzarella salad that came as a side was good.  The staff at the door greeted us when we got there but not when we left.

TGIF is the place to go for happy hr! They have amazing deals on food and drinks! I wanna give a shout out to Shaun, my server when my bf and I were dining in the bar area! Shaun is one of the best servers I've ever had! He kept checking up on us during dinner and was just extremely positive! He even sneaked in cake and ice cream on the house for my bfs birthday! Overall, great experience and will come back again!

Was here for Happy hour and it was fantastic!  Service was great and food was amazing.  Ordered almost everything that was on the happy hour menu and was not disappointed.  There was a Happy Hour section in the restaurant which was very lively!  Will definitely come back here!
I haven't had anything bad here yet. The service is pretty good and the food is like any other T.G.I. Friday's.

The mixed drinks here are really hit or miss, and that's so disappointing for a Friday's.  I like the atmosphere and the food is pretty decent.  This is a good place to chill for late night happy hour.

Came here for Mother's Day and was not impressed with the service.  Maybe because they were down a cook or something but it took us a good 30 min after we ordered to get our food and we were one of the first ones there.  Server didn't come to check up on us much so we couldn't alert someone about how we've been waiting for a while which made us a little annoyed just because we saw other people getting food that came after us.  The manager did visit our table and she was kind enough to take some of our entrees off. When we finally did get our food it was pretty good. Maybe because I was starving but I was pretty satisfied. Everyone else was happy with their food too.  This TGIF is somewhat new but I was a little surprised for everything to seem so hectic when the day just started.  Honestly though, this probably isn't going to stop me from going to TGIF but maybe think twice about going to this one.

I've been to TGI Friday's over the years, but never had such a cool, friendly, and professional server as Victoria.  My buddies and I went here yesterday for late lunch and they enjoyed Happy Hour.  I'm not drinking alcohol nor soda this year, so I went along for the food. Victoria was on the ball and literally knew when to show up with refills and everything.  I had the feeling she was an executive who wanted to do something fun outside of the corporate rat race.  She was very well-spoken and knew how to relate to us from the start.   We appreciated her tolerance of our loud and silly behavior, as I bet that could be trying at times.  She was calm and never seemed to have to run too fast to catch up with things.  She had everything under control and that was impressive. We will be back again, I am sure.

So what am I going to do when someone gives me a giftcard to a chain joint like this? Honestly I will grudgingly use it. All the while I hate myself for using it and eating their garbage here. Yeah I said garbaaaaaj... Almost everything that the munchkin and I got was bleh from the service to the food to the watered down adult beverage (only one since the munchkin was with me). So yeah the one great saving grace were the pretzel sticks appetizer with cheese sauce. Those things rocked after they finally arrived after the rest of our grub. =\ Pro Tip: Its next to the freeway at the Rosemead Plaza (Target shopping center) However we were there for happy hour appetizer deals and sat at the high tables near the bar to get the deals. Well, the rest of the grub was ehhh if that. We had sliders, teriyaki beef skewers, fries, non slushie slushies (well the munchkins =\) ... The skewers were a bit tough and the sauce wasn't like most teriyaki sauces I have had, a bit thick and very sweet. The slider was very average at best. The fries were standard average fries.  The non slushie slushie simply melted before the munchkin could drink hardly any of it. It didn't retain its slushieness for more than about 5-10 minutes and it wasn't even a hot day! I got an electric lemonade and couldn't even tell it wasn't a virgin drink... it was supposed to have a drop or two of vodka in it per the menu. Then there was the service. Our waiter was busy talking to the waitresses running around  in the restaurant more than pay attention to any of the tables that were in his section. We had to flag other staff down to find our waiter for us 3 times. =\ Overall it was a very disappointing trip. We loved the pretzels so much that those prevented the trip from being a complete one star bust.

We need a TGIF in the San Gabriel Valley so finally there's one here! We've been here a couple of times and yes, the waiters have messed up on our orders but we got a discount each time so it was ok :-). The atmosphere was pretty cool tool (I love the bar stools and the mini booths!!)  It's not gourmet food...and it wasn't that bad so 3 stars it is :-). Service is HIT or MISS (MISS if you're using coupons). I will come here again for comfort food :-).

This place is pretty big.  It has a nice bar with multiple big screen TV's and ample seating in the restaurant.  Décor is nice and new.  The server we had was not too friendly.  The deals they show on TV will not appear on the menu, nor will they say anything about it, unless you ask.  I find that a little sneaky.  We did order something from the 2 for $20 menu.  However, most of the good items you have to add another $3 or $5 dollars to it.  I ordered a pasta with chicken and shrimp.  It was OK, but I thought there was too much alfredo sauce.  The lower rating I'm giving is pretty much because of our server.  I ordered a strawberry lemonade.  It was about $3 something.  it was filled 3/4 with ice.  They also charge .49 cents for refill.  I got the refill and when the bill came they charged me for 2 drinks.  I talked to the server about it and he pretended not to know anything.  He did correct the bill, but offered no apology or anything.  It also got frustrating because it was hard to find him.  The place was packed but they need to improve their service.  I'm not sure if the other servers were like that, but the waiter we had was rude. Price is also expensive for the quality of food they serve.

Every time I go, I have a pretty bad experience. I will literally drive all the way to West Covina next time if I'm craving Fridays. The first time I went (they had just opened) the spinach dip was stone cold in the middle. The second time my burger was completely bloody inside... And I love my meat practically moving but not for a burger... The third time I went for lunch thinking it would be better because it wasn't busy, the food TOOK FOREVER. My friends chicken tasted like a rubber tire and they messed our bill. I tried with this restaurant but I have no idea how many more times I can go and be disappointed

Went here for lunch, and the lunch special selection was pretty good.  Prices ranged from $5.99 to $7.99.  Got the California Cobb Sandwich for $7.99, and it was delicious.  They also offer all desserts $2.00 off at lunch, but got too full fromthe sandwich so did not get dessert.  Wait staff here is really attentive and nice.  Would definitely stop by again.

We went on a sunday afternoon. Ot was not busy as we got a table right away. We say for 10 mins without anyone taking our drink order.  Food was delicious. The sever we had was no good. We asked for extra ranch and were still waiting for it.

Why I'm always giving this place another try? Beats me. The service is always slow when I go here. The servers are nice but they're never around when you need something. It took my sister and I approximately 15 minutes to get the check because our waitress was no where to be found. I ordered the chicken bruschetta pasta and I did not like it. The chicken was too hard to chew, rubbery. It had no flavor at all. In addition the pasta was too oily. My sister ordered the endless soup and salad deal for lunch. The soup wasn't bad, she ordered clam chowder. The bread it came with was really good. It was hot, soft and fluffy. I didn't try the salad but she seemed to be okay with it. I think only the appetizers are good here. I tend to enjoy the spinach dip very much. It's not too salty or cheesy.

I usually come here for the typical American food I crave such as pasta, flat bread, or cocktail. I'm sure TGI Friday is a common place for the majority of the people and their menu is laid out in their website.  The branch for this TGI Friday's provides great service and is not too busy whether it is weekday or weekend.  I've been here several times and so far their service or food have not disappoint me especially with consistency.   Recommendation/Favorites: [Appetizers]: Chips and dip, Cocktail (I find it a bit pricey on this), B.B.Q Chicken Flat bread, Bread Sticks (Good!!).  [Main Dish]: Chicken Pasta (I forgot what is the exact name but they also have this dish on the weekday $5 menu.  [Dessert]: Chocolate brownie with vanilla Ice Cream (I forgot the exact name).  [Drinks]: Strawberry Lemonade (there is an extra charge for refills).   Price: Same as every other American food restaurants.  Depending on the food you order, the price varies.  Although I feel the quality of the food is worth the price.  **Some Current Specials to Check Out** (Please recheck on prices or specials): They have the $5 - $7 menu with half off on dessert or appetizer  It is on the back of the menu and available at a certain time.  I know that it is only available on weekdays but I do not know the specific time.  I am usually there at lunch when I order the specials.   Service: Great service since it is an American restaurant.  Although I do wish they can add my rewards points to my member rather than giving me the receipt and telling me to bring the kept receipt next time so the points can be added in to my member.  (I usually don't remember bringing the receipt). Joining their Member:  They have this membership where you would receive points per receipt when you visit the restaurant.  It is free.  Just ask about their membership and their employee's will help you sign-up with provided information.  I think it's a good opportunity to save or eat more if TGI Friday's is a place to be visited often.  For every visit, just bring your member number or your membership card and show it to them for a free chips and dips and to add your received points towards your membership.  There are also possible discounts or coupons emailed to you if email is provided during sign-up.   Parking: It is in the Target/Bed Bath and Beyond Plaza, so plenty.

I went to this restaurant to have dinner with my family and it wasn't a good experience. It took 20 minutes for us to be seated and almost an hour for them to serve our food.  Once the food was served, the food wasn't hot either. It seemed to me that my food was on the counter waiting for my waitress to serve for awhile before it came to my table.  Overall, this place has nothing really stand out. Don't come here if you like your food to be hot and freshly made.

Tips: -Free appetizer with check-in! -Free chips & salsa if you sign up with their free rewards program online -Happy Hour is 3-7PM & 10PM-close Mon-Sat, All day Sunday (half off appetizers except platters+seafood, $3.50 domestic beers, $3 bottled beers, $4 well drinks/wine, 3 different $5 cocktails, and a few other goodies) -20% off fliers are sent in the mail along with local grocery store fliers -3 items for "$25" deals (you can add-on or opt for a higher priced option), which includes an appetizer or dessert plus 2 entrees. I gave this place 4-stars because we had such exceptional service! Our waiter was great about checking in on us and refilling our waters. We left him a nice tip for his awesomeness! The food was pretty good too! Food: -Buffalo Hot Wings Appetizer ("$9.99"-- free with check-in!): The sauce was seriously the best I've ever had! The wings were a tad bit over done, but the sauce definitely made up for it. Comes with your choice of ranch or bleu cheese & carrots + celery. -Spinach Florentine Flatbread Appetizer (3 items for $25): Crispy, crunchy, not too cheesy, and delicious! Definitely a good alternative to heavy pizz. -Balsamic Glazed Chicken Caesar Salad (3 items $25): I was looking for something more on the light side since I knew we were going heavy on the appetizers, and this salad hit the spot! Crunchy croutons, sliced baby tomatoes, chicken, fresh lettuce, and a really good dressing! -Dragonfire Chicken (3 items for $25): My boyfriend ordered this, and I had a few bites and it was delicious! I love jasmine rice, and the sauce on top of the chicken was so good! The veggies were a bit undercooked, but I like them crunchy! Order it! I'd come back again!

location: East Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
review: I love coming here for happy hour. It's a good place to catch up with an old friend and the environment is not too loud. Haven't been to a Fridays for ages! Cause It wasn't that great for a long while, but with the new and improved Menu and sauces I'm a fan once again! This particular Fridays is great, cause it's off to a corner, so plenty of parking. Staff and manager are all so friendly I know especially cause I was here back to back for 3 plus days (due to figure out company party menu). JD sause sampler is DELICIOUS!!! Who would have known JD can make such a good sauce?! the rib is tender, the chicken got a crunch to it. YUM Happy hour got great selection of drinks and appetizer for an AWESOME price.  Entrees I've tried: Dragon fire salmon (4/5) Surprisingly good! Not dry and the tangy Kung Pao sauce wasn't too overwhelming. My friend had the Parmesan steak fries, very very yummy. Not crispy cause they are quite large in pieces, but very flavorful, I think it's both cheese and butter:P Petite Sirloin(2/5) A bit on the dry size, but it's not a steak house so didn't expect it to be great anyways. I had mine entree with sweet potato fries which are delicious and their chef's veggie selection, is not good at all. Yuck. Wedge Salad (3/5) interesting concept. But it's very hard to eat. I ended up chopping everything up so it tasted just like another salad. Not bad but I would go with normal salad next time. JD Burger (4/5) all the JD selection are generally delicious cause the sauce is pretty addicting. Burger is average, but the sauce made it awesome. seasoned fries are average as well. Chicken Brachutta Pasta (3/5) Not bad. The pasta sauce was yummy, but Im guessing they made a big batch and server it whenever someone orders it. Cause the pasta was luke warm. Chicken is dry like i expected, but really wish the pasta was hot. Food as in entree are average. But Food as in appetizer/ happy hour small bites, they are delicious and price make them even better. The good rating is based on the overall experience, including food, atmosphere, and service.

I have to say this is the 3rd time coming to this place but first in Rosemead. We came as a party of 9 and I can not be more impressed with this place, there service was on point. From the greeting in the front to our server Raul. He was very attentive and very professional. I will definitely be visiting this place again. Raul is an asset to your company, he made my family feel welcomed. Thank you TGI

I went here in hopes that since it's a new restaurant that it might be better than what I experienced years ago in West Covina but it still sucks in my opinion. I got food poisoning years ago from the shrimp so I went ahead and tried the lobster with ribs that came with sweet potatoe fries and slaw this time. My review for this location..1 star shy of perfect. But only because one dish came out cold and oily.  Staff/service, happy nice on point from the time you enter till you leave.
