Server Ruben (?) was very good. (Friday night)  Bar is very loud, and seats near bar are very loud. If come back ask for seating around outside edge.  Food is pretty salty in general.  BBQ ribs is good, better than steak. I should Get a full rack next time.  Fries are good.  Salad is normal.  Oreo cookie madness is OK, nothing special.
Food is always hot and service is very friendly just wish i could enjoy happy hour but all that will change within a week cause my lil one will be here then i can celebrate!

3 stars because the good food saved this from being 2 stars.  Food alone would have been 4 stars.  Still missing Sean... our favorite server.  Whitney was good, although she seemed in a rush; asked about dessert when we were only 2/3 through dinner.    She was in such a hurry to clear our plates while we were still finishing our dinner that I asked if there was a shortage of dishware in the kitchen.    Also had to ask twice for napkins and had to ask for the wetnaps as well.  Really?  We had RIBS!
Why have a kitchen open till close if food is going to be reheated or not made to standard.

My husband and I eat here at least once a week. We love the feel and the attitude of the servers. What I also like is that most of them recognize us from previous visits :).  Servers here are attentive,  management is always nice and welcoming. No matter what, we always end up here :). For many good reasons.

Being my first time here,  I didn't know how things will be after walking through those sets of doors.  As the doors opened, the sound of loud music greeted us. The hostess quickly assisted us. She walked us towards the Bar area, asked us if we would like to be seated here.  We declined due to very loud music & the crowds that were there cheering on their teams on TV.  She took us to the dinning area, seated us at a booth. Our server Melissa introduced herself. We told her the this is our first time here so she quickly showed us the specials on the menu plus she also told us that Sunday is All Day Happy Hour. She took the time to explain the different entrées, appetizers, & prices.  We ordered the Mozzarella Sticks for the Appetizer, for the entree: 2 for $20 plus an upgrade fee of $5 for the Flatiron Steak with loaded baked potato & Onion rings. The second entree: $3 upgrade for the Petite Sirloin, mixed Veggies, & loaded baked potato.  Both our steaks were ordered Med...The steaks came out to Med Well. Melissa took our steaks back & had new ones fired up right away. The loaded baked potatoes were dressed in green onions not chives & no bacon. She did however brought us extra butter & sour cream. My mixed veggies were fresh not frozen, Al dente but lacked seasonings so I added butter, S&P. The onion rings were soggy. The steaks came  but it appeared the grill person rushed because the steaks came out burnt on the outside & med rare on the inside. Every bite was bitter & then the raw tasting on the inside. The dessert was a Vanilla Bean Cheesecake. Not bad. You can see the Vanilla seeds. The crust was moist given to it was a Graham Cracker crust.  Melissa was quick to refill our drinks. She did state that TGIF does not specialize in steaks so there it is & I know that this is not a steak house so no expectations there. Overall,  food is mediocre but service was better than the food. Leaving this place sort of made me feel that I had just left a club more than a Restaurant.

Sucks man I should of red yelp before I got here the people are nice I give em a star for that. but the burgers were tooo soggy no flavor the only thing was good was the beer and the nachos. but naw I wont come back here this was my first time dining at a FRIDAYS  but no I wont come back no more

Came in with some friends last night to catch up and grab a bite to eat. Compared to other TGI Friday's, I feel like this one was louder. It wasn't horrible, but noticeable. Service was good, nothing special or notable. Food was pretty good. Being a vegetarian (pretty recently, 4 months is recent right?), I was worried about my choices. I used to love anything from the Jack Daniel's menu and the last time I was in (December), I loved the new burgers. For whatever reason, my mind was set on a burger this time too. I knew I could substitute a black bean patty on any burger, but when I saw the Sonoma Black Bean burger, I was sold. Everything about this burger was right. Start with the bun, it was fluffy and perfect. They give you the standard onion, tomato, and lettuce. The onion was perfectly strong, just the way I like it. Everything else was good. They then top it with a pepper aioli of sorts. Spicy, but not distracting. Creamy, but with a kick. There was also avocado. There's no way you can go wrong with avocado. No. Way. Let's talk about the main event, the black bean patty. Burgers are what made me hesitant to adopt the vegetarian lifestyle. I love burgers and Boca patties are horrid. The three vegetarian black bean burgers I've had at different places so far have been incredible (Fuddrucker's, Mohawk Bend in Echo Park, and Rounds in Pasadena). Friday's is no different. The patty was delicious. Black beans mixed with spices and bell pepper and corn (I could be mistaken). The outside was crispy, the inside was tender. It wasn't at all like any beef patty I've had, but I love it all the same. I really like the flavor and texture of the patty, really good. Friday's has always had my favorite fries. They're salty, peppery, and perfectly crisp. Yum!

I used to go to TGI Fridays every sunday after church when i was growing up. I hadn't been living in a city that had one in almost 10 years, so I was super excited that after moving to LA, I was able to talk my friend into driving 45 minutes with me to get it. When we arrived, we were seated, and ignored. After 20 minutes, i got up and complained to the host, and he found us our waitress. We recognized her as the woman who had walked past us and looked at us at least 6 times. She only had two other tables. It was not busy. She was just walking around bored. She took our order, and then took another 15 minutes to bring us our drinks, and didn't even take the menus. We were never given or offered refills, even though our drinks were empty for most of the meal. A different waitress ran our food out to us, and none of the sauces that we requested were present, and the fries were HARD as if they had been sitting out for about an hour. We complained about the fries, and she brought us new ones, and they were the same. I have had your fries a million times before. This is not how they are. They were gross. I asked if you had Au Jus sauce for my steak, and the waitress had no clue what it was, and then eventually brought me out some other sauce that was not even close to au jus and claimed that it was. I signed up for the rewards program to get a free appetizer, and finding her to get that was like pulling teeth. When we were finishing our meal, she came up to us, interrupted, and rushed us out, saying she needed to clock out, so we needed to pay now. I have been looking forward to this for years, and it was the worst service i have ever had in my life. I looked for the fridays website on google, and found a ton of other reviews for the same location that said the same thing. What's going on?! I hope that you can do something to make this better. Fridays used to hold a big space in my heart, and now I'm not sure I ever want to go back. I tried to submit this via the website, and kept getting an error message. It's disappointing that your site does not even function well enough to hear my complaint. ***UPDATE*** I originally posted this to facebook, and was told that I would get a call from a manager in 1 or 2 days, and no one even bothered to call me, and nothing was done to improve the situation.

Food is alright, the best part of Fridays is the happy hour! You can't go anywhere else and get the amount of food/cheap drinks for a great price, but if you are going here outside of happy hour I don't think it's worth the money food is average at best. Desserts are bomb though..... Game days be prepared to wait a while!

Made a reservation for a group of us, they even sent me a couple of text messages to confirm. The group showed up and they seemed to he surprised when I said we had a reservation. They tried to find a corner for us and put tables together.  Food was not bad, but not the best neither.

Service is always great here, Happy hr at 9pm, appetizers Nd drinks half off. I rly liked their sampler plate and alcohol is always on point. The last server we had was very attentive, and customized our needs with food as well as drinks. Also reminded us about happy hour, so we wouldn't have to pay full price (:

Took 30 mins to get my meal?? I been to other TGI Fridays and there service is always 100%. This location is a total opposite. They take forever to get your meal. Corporate needs to be called cause this is unnessary

As soon as we walked in, we were greeted and immediately seated. Service was excellent here (the waiters often asked us if we needed anything), but I feel that the price was just WAY too expensive for the portions served..Two small sides and a main course dish could run you for $20, and you might still be hungry afterwards! I ordered steak and some shrimp along with a baked potato and coleslaw. Did I already state that the sides were SMALL? The small coleslaw that I ordered literally came in a tiny bowl that was probably 2 inches in diameter and height. There were only about 5 pieces of shrimp. The steak was about 6-7 inches, and lastly the baked potato was three quarters the size of the steak (~5 inches)... All for $20. The reason that this place earned 3 stars was that the quality was quite decent and tasty, although I would rather pay much less for moderately lower quality food but larger portions. Just my two cents as a poor college student.

Only reason I'm giving 2 stars would be because I absolutely love their jack Daniels sauce. But besides that customer service was the worst ever! Waiter took over half hr to bring out my meal and I mean I would understand if it's super busy but that was not the case at 12am. not once did he come to our table we even had to call him over to hand us our bill which he absolutely took his very sweet time to cash out!!! Ughh was very frustrating & disappointing i  didn't catch his name but was a Hispanic guy with glasses  won't be coming here anytime soon
I brought my wife and two kids to this place. We ordered Ribeye & Lobster and Steak & Lobster.   The server was awesome.  She always there when needed.
Waited 20 minutes for my order. Waiter came with check and obv forgot to put our order in. When it came out it had less portions than a can of spaghetti-o's.

Thank got its Friday.  If you haven't been to the newly open tgi Friday in Rosemead, you miss a lot. Anything with jack Daniel sauce is marvelous. Their signature baby back ribs is a must try dish. Don't forget the baked potato too. Every employee is happily with a smile on their face.

The staff here is ridiculous. Why make us wait 10 minutes when there are more than a dozen empty tables. There's no shortage of staff either. The podium doesn't fit three people. Have the 2 wingmen work some tables instead of talking. Their excuse for our table taking so long was stupid. "We are getting your table ready" Please it's not that hard to put a pre-wrapped knife and fork on the table in front of each chair. I see that every table around us is completely ready. Their staff is unprofessional overall The food was whatever. Nothing special.

Restaurant is large and was able to easily accomodate our party of 14.  The service is average, the typical chain restaurant staff of "overworked, understaffed, hurry up and leave me alone" experience.  Funny how we have been numbed to be accustomed and accept such in our dining experience nowadays. The food?   I was already not expecting anything exemplary or anything more than something tepid....I was not disappointed.  But hey they threw in for free 3 scoops of ice cream with some topping  and a rousing Happy Birthday TGIF rendition singing by the overworked understaffed hurry up and leave me alone wait staffs.

I recommend their Jack Daniel burger and their craft beer burger. Can't go wrong with their spicy buffalo wings,  sesame chicken and ahi tuna crisps. For dessert their Tennessee whiskey cake and brownie with ice cream is to die for. Their cocktails and margaritas are also really good.  Lastly, their service is definitely something to write home about. I've only good things to say about this place

Let me start of with the moment u walk in here , u have Michelle the host she could really make you feel welcomed she had great customer service and she could really make ur 40 min wait feel like 15 min ,   We got our food I got the 1/2 rack of ribs and lobster tail I really didn't think my money was worth that lobster tail  , it looked more like a piece of shrimp of how tiny it was , our waiter was jasmine she was sweet I really enjoyed all the customer service here if it wasn't for them , I wouldn't even add a review here thanks Fridays , lll be coming back :) but just not for a lo stair tail

My boyfriend's parents really like coming here on special occasions. I almost always get the same thing; it's either the garlic shrimp skillet (3 stars) or the Jack Daniel's steak & two sides (4 stars). Their appetizers are great! The Jack Daniel's Sampler is mouthwatering. Upon my last visit, I had the mocktail. Least to say, it smells like a real cocktail and I was jumping around for 3 hours after all the Red Bull in that drink. The reason for the loss of 2 stars is the service. There are so many tables available yet there is always a long line to get a table. It takes a really long time for servers to take your order, bring your food, bring the check, and bring dessert. The servers aren't very attentive and after finishing my mocktail, my glass, along with other glasses around my table were not refilled for the rest of the night.

Came here for the second time and was with my boyfriend. We went for the endless apps but were disappointed when the server said that we couldn't share and we ended up not getting it. I was trying to be really nice but she took forever with all of the food. We waited for about twenty minutes before she took our order. But before that she came every two minutes. It was really frustrating. What's worse is the fact that after we got appetizers she disappeared and took forever to get us refills and our actual meal. And I would understand if the restaurant was packed but it was ridiculously empty. The only thing that made it better was the fact that the food was exactly what i was expecting. It was delicious and so was the company. But it took her just as long to give us the check and remove plated from our table. We waited for fifteen minutes before she took and returned our card. I hope next time i don't see my waitress with another table more than I see her with mine.

Worst Fridays ever. Servers leaves after sitting us down. No new server is brought to us. Asked the manger for my drink. Asked the manager for our food. Finally he came after my girl Jude's asked to take my charred steak off the bill. Said hell take care it. Saved the experience almost. Smh smh smh

I had never been to TGIF but my dad had been wanting to try it ever since his friend told him that it was his favorite place. We went on a Friday night one day and the wait was too long for us so we ate at another restaurant. We went again on a Wednesday around 4 pm and it was not busy at all. We got seated right away.  It was five of us and we usually get a booth. However the host told us that in order to get the happy hour appetizers and drinks we had to sit around the bar. We ended up sitting on a regular high table which was a bit of an inconvenience for my parents. I don't see why you can't get happy hour appetizers when you sit on the regular tables?! But whatever.  Our server was really friendly which was a plus. He brought us our drinks fast and came by several times to make sure they were always full. Our food came out pretty fast as well, I'm sure it's because it was not busy. I got the Cajun shrimp pasta, it was delicious except for the shrimp, such a disappointment. The pasta itself was good, it also had pieces of chicken which was also good. The shrimp had a weird taste to it. My sister and dad got ribs and oh my they were DELICIOUS!! I will probably get that next time. My mom got a different pasta and she wasn't a big fan of it, I did not try it. My other sister got a burger and she said it was alright. I also got the spinach flat bread and it was perfect!!! I definitely recommend it!  Overall the service was great and the food was good.

Saw the recent commercial of the Endless Appetizers which is very tempting. So I came with friends but was told it's for a person only and there is NO SHARING! WTH!? Watch your misleading commercial again!!!!! Don't you see how many hands were grabbing the appetizer from the same plate???  Felt cheated, very shady business practice.
Saddest looking Togo appetizer. I can't believe they would give this out. Looks like someone ate it before giving it to me. More like leftovers.

What can you expect from a chain? Not the most mind blowing experience.  Food was typical.  Drinks were just meh which prob explains why I don't come here unless it's convenient. Took 10 mins for the waitress tl bring back our cc which to me is not cool since it was dead and lord knows what could be happening with our cards in her possession. Shit like that still happens.

For my first time here, I went with my boyfriend for the ayce appetizers. I highly recommend the spinach dip and the buffalo wings, that way you'd get your fair share for the price. Whenever we wanted to refill our orders or our drinks our waiter was who knows where. Had to wait almost ten minutes before we saw him again. At the end of the night, we paid the bill with about 20% of the bill left. Since service wasn't so great, we waited. Waited and waited. Finally about 15 minutes later our waiter comes back and actually asked "oh did you want your change?" Like, are you kidding me? Even if you believed you did great serving us, its still common sense to give us our change back. Second time we came here, we wanted to give it another chance so we decided to invite another couple for a double date. Food was good. Waitress was a helluva lot better than the waiter we had the first time.  Always checked up on our table. Refilled our drinks. There were only two problems I really had with this night. First was when I was walking to the restroom, another waitress was running like a madwoman to the kitchen and bumped into me and didn't apologize. Its common decency to do so but I just let it slide. Second was that service was quite slow, especially for a night that didn't have many customers. So, to summarize, two stars for food. Half star for service.

For me, TGI Friday's was always a hit or a miss. The food today was pretty mediocre, in all honesty... overly salty, but our service was impeccable.  My brother walked in, anticipating to get their special AYCE $10 appetizer deal, but after looking through the menu I contemplated on just getting a sandwich, but opted out. Kinda regretted it, but oh well.  Stephany was our waitress, and she was very friendly with us, by greeting us with the warmest smile, and always very sincere whenever she talked to us. I decided to get the Boneless Buffalo Wings in Tennessee BBQ sauce as my first round, and my brother ordered the Loaded Potato Skins appetizers. At the time, we didn't know what we wanted, but Stephany gave us a bunch of recommendations of what were more popular amongst guests, and any specials going on at the time. She was more than just patient with us, but was understanding since we didn't know what to choose.  Some notes: AYCE Appetizers - $10/person. About 5-6 options to choose from. Parmesan Steak Fries - $3.99 The food did take some time to come out to us, which didn't make any sense, but no biggie. Right when Stephany brought us out our appetizers, she had immediately asked if we wanted to place another order since they did take a while to come out. And we thought it was great, because we thought we would have to wait forever again for round two. I chose the Garlic Parmesan as my next order, and my brother continued onto round two of his Loaded Potato Skins.  The Tennessee BBQ sauce on the boneless wings were delicious! I am usually pretty picky about sauces, since I tend to like it a bit more savory, than tangy and sweet... but these were great. Seasoning was perfect, and the chicken was actually pretty moist for our first round. The coating of the boneless wing was super thick as you can expect, but not as heavy as Buffalo Wild Wings. Thankfully, the thick coating didn't allow for a salty taste. It also came with a side of celery.  The Loaded Potato Skins are supposed to be one of the more popular appetizers at TGI Friday's, and these were our first time having them, but they were so greasy and overly crispy. The cheese tasted like imitation, like the cheese from a ritz cheese cracker... but even that's tastier. The bacon was okay, I didn't think ti was anything special. And it was served with a scallion sour cream sauce. I've heard good things about this, but felt like it fell short of execution. We didn't care much for them. The Garlic Parmesan Boneless Wings came out next, as well as the other round of Loaded Potato Skins. The style that TGI Friday's was similar to Wingstop's, The coating on these wings seemed a bit thicker, and the chicken came out dry. It was basically sitting in a wash of butter, and no parmesan.. boo. I definitely wouldn't order that again. Earlier during our first round, I had asked if I could switch out the celery for some carrots, and Stephany brought me a mound of baby carrots... score!  Lastly, came out the Classic Buffalo Boneless Wings. I like buffalo wings, but maybe it was because we were already full, that we couldn't really eat them anymore. I felt like te sauce was a bit too tangy though.  Also, our Parmesan Steak Fries came out last, since we did order it mid-way into our meal. Again, it seems like TGIF likes to drown their food in butter, since that's pretty much what it was. I paid $3.99 for steak fries... and it came out with 5 potato wedges sitting in butter, topped with some parmesan. For $3.99, I expected better.  Even if the food wasn't great, the service here was excellent. The host in the front was a younger male, and he was nice enough to open the doors for us, even if we haven't even came into the restaurant yet. I didn't catch his name, but he was very friendly with us, and even opened the door for us as we left. Stephany was great throughout our meal. She checked up on us a few times, refilling our drinks, and providing us with extra napkins without asking. For our food here, I would honestly give it 1-2 stars. But with our wonderful waitress, she is the reason I bumped up my star count. If it weren't for the service, I would've only given 1. Stephany, you were awesome!

I have to give it a star or else I wouldn't give anything.  This is by far THE worse TGIF!  Not only the food was bad (not sure how you can messed up a smoked dish, but they did), the service was horrible as well.  They basically just gave us our dish and walked off.  We asked for refills on our chips and drinks and they never came back with it.  We asked twice as well.  The only time they came to us quick was when we asked for our bill, which they even over charged us by adding extra taxes on our bill.  I've never had probs with TGIF before till we went to this one.  They should be glad that we still tipped them.  So my advice to you, don't even bother to try it.

You kind of know what you are getting going in, but that really doesn't make it ok. Our server was nice enough, but the food here is simply garbage. My husband's steak was half fat and my ribs were blah. I know people come here for more than that-drinks, the game whatever. You really should have more respect for your bodies and your taste.  To add to the annoyance, the waiters were moving tables around and screeching them across the floor right next to us. It's a factory. Avoid.

This tgif is okay, thats all I can say about it pretty much. The food is okay not fantastic and not bad. I usually come during happy hour because most of their menu is pricey for what you get. I would give it a higher score for happy hour but the last time i came. They gave me literally all drumstick part of the wings with literally no wings.

Went for lunch with the family and I was happy with the service and food.  I don't think I have ever left a chain TGI unsatisfied.  We pretty much know what we are getting with no surprises. This restaurant is located closer to the freeway, so head that direction so you don;t get lost in the huge parking lot of businesses.

Food consistency is a hit or miss. Each time I come here, I order the sirloin medium rare and it comes out different each time. There are times when the meat quality isn't up to par. It wasn't that busy for them to rush out the food and end up not being cooked to previous experiences. However, each time I came here (usually Thursday nights) our server/bartender Damien (the one with the dreads) has given us AWESOME service. He's made my experience here a good one despite the food.  Some days, I feel this place gets a 4 and today's experience is a 3.

Just went there an hour ago, waited for half an hour for a table for 2. Finally got a table then telling us if you're coming for the happy hour, you have to be seating in the bar area, which is first come first serve. So it's my fault that I didn't tell them I'm here for the happy hour. That's fine. Taking us to a table in the bar area that having been clean yet and promising it will be cleaned soon, but in fact the guest at that table just went to the restroom and came back... We had to go back to the lobby and wait for another seats again. When we arrived, we're happy and having fun before, but it's all been ruined and still hungry. We left of course and not planning to go back anymore. We have been there every month for years, it's a good way to let go your loyal customers.
Don't order the potato skins on the endless apps. They suck! Wings, mozzarella, and potstickers are great!!!
Great service, amazing flavor in the Jack Daniels Sampler! Delicious in my book. Birthday friendly you get free ice cream just show your ID.
The staff members here are extremely friendly and helpful! Had a satisfied meal and a great time~ the server Octavio was awesome :D

Service was really really good. Its my birthday Tuesday and he made me feel like a big deal! Lol. Food was ok. Every time I come i order the steak with lobster. Lobster always sucks. Like sucks sucks.  :( Steak is like whatever. Drinks are always on point. Ask for Ricardo, hes the best!!

This has been my regular Sunday Football place.  There are MANY TVs and they have ALL DAY HAPPY HOUR. Half off appetizers, Cheap Beers.  What else do you need. Service is always on point. I REALLY Wish they had the Volume for the Niners Game instead of the TOP40 music....but I understand why they cant.  Too many other games going on. This will be my Sunday spot until I can find a Niner Bar close to my house.

I ate lunch at TGI Friday's in Rosemead, CA on 10/13/2014 (Columbus Day).  I've eaten here several times before.  This time I had a Philly Burger with fries ($11.79) and a Raspberry Tea ($2.99).  My server, Laura, did a fine job.  Plus, I took photos.  What was new to me was their Ziosk machines which are at each table.  They advertise menu items (no surprise), play video games for a price (no surprise) and also allow you to pay your bill right at your table (surprise).  Oreo Madness was something you eat and not a video game --- but maybe it should be.

AVOID ALL TGI FRIDAYS! Appetizers taste like they were microwaved, service was slow, and they had the call to say that Samuel Adams beer doesn't count as a domestic beer. The experience would have been salvaged if my group was closer to the TVs to watch the game, then at least I could distract myself from how bad the experience was.

Long story short - average review for lack of apology, bad explanation/excuses/service, bad tasting boneless buffalo wings - would've been a 0-1 star review but I'm giving 3 because I've had some good times at this and other TGIF locations.  Came to this place with my sisters tonight. We ordered 2 orders of bone-in buffalo wings, 1 order of potato skins, 1 margarita, 1 long island iced tea to start off. The server came back 5 mins later and said that they RAN OUT of bone-in buffalo wings tonight and asked if we wanted something else instead so we opted for the boneless version. RIGHT after he took our entree order, a different guy came over with bone-in buffalo wings and potato skins but only dropped off buffalo wings. We didn't touch it since we were told that they ran out of it and  that it must belong to someone else's. The guy came back and said, "oh, you guys didn't order this huh? took it and put down the potato skin. So I asked, "So you guys still have bone-in buffalo wings?" and he said "yes", "but our server said you guys ran out of it?", he didn't reply and looked around.  Our server ran up to him and said something to him and they went back to the kitchen. 5 minutes later the manager came out and said, "the bone-in wings just came out of the oven" "I thought you guys ran out of it?" "yes, they just came out of the oven" so I said, "Ok". Our server didn't come back AT ALL until we were ready for the check. So I confronted him: - "so you guys have the bone-in wings now?" and he said,  - "yes, do you want to place an order now =} ?"  - "why did you tell me that you guys ran out of the bone-in wings?"  - "Well my manager already explained"  - "We would've waited if you explained"  - "We didn't have it at the time...I could get you some right now for free if you want" - "No thank you." We still tipped 18% against my wishes. Overall the whole situation put me in a bad mood--The boneless wings tasted worse than chicken nuggets; I felt like we were lied to; We didn't get an apology;Their explanation or excuses are bad so it makes you feel worse. We came for a good night out, not for your offer of free food!! I go to TGIF somewhat regularly but tonight totally ruined my day...me suggesting and bringing my sisters here hoping for a good night out but they end up seeing me upset. I was told to let it go and not to write a review and not to mention the server's name...well we left the place within 30-40 mins or so, I can spare some time to rant.

Well just as you would expect. This is one of those commercialized locations. You either are going to enjoy your food because it is mass produced or you are going to hate your food because it is mass produced. I either case...when you come to a joint like this, you know what to expect so don't be surprised.
Good service the waitress let us order from the Happy Hour menu at the table versus the bar. The Happy Hour menu is very limited/weak. They charged us for our friends birthday ice cream. WTF!

Can someone please explain to me why there are 3 hostesses chatting and ignoring guests. Or why the restaurant has about 85% of tables empty and there's a 20 minutes wait. Or why there's also 3 waiters standing in one of the dining rooms just talking.  I don't understand.  I'm pretty sure I don't need my college degree to tell me that restaurants make money when patrons are actually DINING and being helped. Instead of having a full lobby but empty tables. But maybe this is some new business concept I didn't learn since I didn't get my masters like so many of my friends.
The Food isn't that great. And the service is terrible because it took like 40 minutes to get a sprite. Not a recommended place to go to. Definitely not going back

Really bad service! If I had the option of giving no stars I would! The waiter we had was extremely rude. Once we arrived he walked up to our table and told us to "choose our food quickly so it's not a waste of his time". While asking for a refile on water he said "you need to wait because it is not my priority". Overall it was a horrible experience. They need to train their waiters how to speak to human beings with respect.

This was not a pleasant dinner all the waitress did was talk about her boys , and my second waiter tool the wrong order .My son got a very hard piece of steak and his shrimp wasn't cooked all the way. This was not a pleasant dinner for my son's bday.
Horrible! Ate there tonight and 3 hours later I have horrible food poisoning! Biggest mistake ever coming here.

If I could give 0 stars I would! Came in and sat at the bar area. No service at all until the hostess gave us a menu. She said our server would be right with us. As tgif regular at the west covina one I was very disappointed by this location. Sat and waited for 45 minutes and still no service. All waiters were just looking the other way. I don't know if it was cause I was asian or what but seriously "looking the other way" everytime I stared them down. After waiting and waiting I gave up and just walked out. This location sucks ass. I rather take my money else where. Sorry tgif Rosemead location you lost me as a customer.

Food is the same for tgif everywhere but this location is packed.  The great thing about this place is that there is always tons of parking.  I love the bar area. Tons of tvs. You can get Confused but you also will not miss any of the action.  This is right off the rosemead exit off the 10 fwy so easy to access.

Haven't been to TGIF in awhile. Their food has never impressed me, just so so. I didn't go tonight, but my girlfriend did and I asked for a burger to go. The burger was bland and the meat patty must've cooked while it was frozen. I regret eating it! It's almost 3am and my stomach is still aching from it. Trying to vomit it out... Never going to eat anything from there again.

Called at 6pm to make a reservation for 3 at 7pm. The young lady on the phone said it wasn't necessary because they were "dead". When we showed up to the restaurant at 6:50pm it was crowed with several people in the reception area waiting to be seated. When we asked how long of a wait it would be for 3  people we were told 25-30 minutes.

In short, stopped by on Christmas Eve for a few drinks since they were open till 11:00pm (i think) and it was actually pretty crowded. Grabbed a booth in the bar area with a friend and our Server (Alex was on the receipt) was super chill and took care of us. Grabbed us our beers and shots in a timely manner and brought out some appetizers quickly as well. Nice to know they are open later than other places on Holidays.

I only go here for happy hour once in awhile which is around 10pm I believe. Happy hour is pretty cheap for most of the appetizers except the platter. This is a good place to hang out with friends and have a drink/snack. The parmesan garlic wings and the spinach dip are my favorite. It gets pretty packed at around 10:30ish so if you wanna come for happy hour, come around 9:50 to get a seat and hang out till 10 to order.
HORRIBLE SERVICE! Can't even get hamburger orders right and they took over an hour! This is not the first time this has happened. No more chances. We will NOT be going back!

Awesome service! Adriana was on point with everything. The food came out pretty fast, even considering how busy it was. 2 stars, only because my bf and I got food poisoning. It was probably the shredded cheese in the quesadilla. The cheese wasn't melted all the way, so it possibly could've been stored out of temp.

Came here on weeknight just before Christmas and I was actually surprised they still had Happy Hour (after 9 PM)! As a french fry addict, I love their fries!  I probably increased my saturated fat/ blood pressure that night with its fattening/ sodium goodness. I had their Long Island, which was pretty weak (it was practically a $6 ice tea! Haha), but service was extremely friendly.  Would definitely come back again.  They also have miniature kiosks at each table which allows you to pay your bill and split it without have to wait to get the attention of your waiter/waitress!

My boyfriend& I are regulars at this TGI FRIDAYS. It's always a hit. Never a miss. The bar area is where we always decide to dine. The wait sometimes is stupid but never for us. The food is always good& the service tops it all off.

TGI Friday is hidden at Rosemead shopping center. I went there for lunch on a Saturday and it wasn't busy at all. There are lots of booths and tables with chairs. The background music aka hip hop or rap was annoying. The waitress is nice and good on refills. My French dip sandwich is tasty with soft bun and small in portion. The fries are crispy and seasoned pepper and sea salt. They also have half price appetizers and cheap prices on drinks for a Saturday.  Plenty of parking to park your car.
White girl bartender is rude, bitch never smiles. And plus bar service sucks. I was waiting on beer for about 15 minutes.

Got there and the host was no where to be found waited 8min then she finally came but instead of paying any attention to me and my husband she tends to another couple and they so kindly told her that we were there first and she still tries to tend to them and they said it once more And then she goes oh!  Then she insisted we sit at the bar SMH...  Then we ordered Cherly temple and Roy Rodger's last time I recalled they came with cherries and so I had to ask, witch was rediculous but what ever and me and my husband always share an order of the endless app cuz we easy about two to three plates and that's it bit they raised the price and said we couldn't do that is OK I'm not coming back I'm sticking to the one in Downey or south gate whatever one that is its way better than this place
Love love LOVE their new endless appetizers for $12. Its a great way to try all of them without spending too much. Also the place is very nice and all the waiters are really friendly.

So I was bored last night and wanted a night out with my girls. I asked them what was a good place to have cheap drinks at and they recommended T.G.I. Friday's.   Walked in and was greeted by a friendly host. He took us to our table and showed us how to use this mini POS system that each table has. It was awesome because we can re-order drinks on that thing but the downfall is when we wanted to reorder appetizers, we had to wait for the server to come around and take our orders.  Anyways, happy hour is after 9pm and we went at 11pm (yes, I know we're night owls. lol) We ordered some insanely cheap appetizers; spinach and artichoke dip, a side of fries, and two orders of the buffalo wings. Kid-you-not, the dip was about $5, fries were $1.50, 8 wings for $4 (I ordered twice because it was so delicious, and also because the wings were so small that it didn't fill me up at all!) We also ordered our Happy Hour drinks which were $6 each, two Electric Blue Lemonades, one Long Island, and two PBR's.  Everything was so freaking good and dirt cheap! I would recommend this place to all my night owl yelpers, HOLLA! xoxo lol

Havn't been to TGIF in a long time. We stop going to TGIF long time ago cause of the price and small portion of food. Saw a CM that they were doing a $12 endless appetizer. We went to give a try. Seems like this location does not do the $12 promo. WTH?! The CM said they offer the $12 promo everyday. We end up ordering regular plate. Our both plates were TOO SALTY. Came here after work, tired and hungry. It was tuesday i think. They happened to have a karaoke night. Some people just had too much liquid courage to sing off tune. The music was too loud. It was pretty stressful but funny at the same time to listen to most people sang badly at the bar area. The food came slow but they came out good. Just like what we ordered. I ordered the brownie ice cream with caramel sauce at the end. Wew good lord it was way too sweet. I think the server or someone just went crazy on the caramel sauce. Food was good. Service sucked.  Got the 10.99 baby rib special on Wednesday. Ordered a salad for a side but the server did no tell me there was an uncharge until I requested the bill.

This location is on point for the most part. The bartenders are attentive and fast. Happy Hour here can't be beat by anything in the area, that's for sure. They have karaoke during the week (i forgot which day it was) and plenty of TVs to watch whatever sporting event is on. The only thing I don't like about TGIF is that they don't play sound during a big game or a fight. Other than that I highly recommend this location.

Friendly staff and awesome bartender and drinks. Disappointed with the appetizer trio we got. The potatoe skins were dry  because they were over cooked, the wings and mozzarella sticks were good but the menu said it was enough for three people and it wasn't...

The food is exactly what you would expect from a TGIFriday restaurant. The rating comes from slow service. We found out later that we could have ordered from the device on the table but it was hidden behind some menus so we couldn't see it. This isn't normally a place I would go and would only go back if someone I am with is already going there.

I come here regularly and the servers are always very cool, but can be pretty slow if you're in the bar area.  Food is always good.  :-)

The Service here is great and fast! The $12 unlimited appetizer deal is terrific! You do have to pay the $12 per person without sharing, but that's understandable. The BBQ  ribs and Pot Stickers are very delicious and filling. Also, the bar dining area is great for groups with upbeat music. I highly recommend this TGIF location.

It took awhile to get our drink order. Our mozzarella stick app took about 20 minutes to come to our table. It was only about 5 minutes our main dishes came. Our waiter was ok; nothing special or over the top about him. Will I go back? Only if I have a gift card to use.

Another place that is very bad.... never had cold chewy lobster then my fiancee ordered a hamburger  and it was like ice .... then she got a mojito which they should of gave her water .....well never go there again...

The food is disgusting because it tastes so cheap and processed.  My friend ordered grilled chicken Nachos and the chicken was so overcooked and dry the chunks stuck together like glue.  I ordered a Mango Berry Margarita and it tasted more like a smoothie than a cocktail.  I couldn't made that slush myself.  Our server wad very nice and patient with us though.

Cooks can't get it it right ?  Really. Great server is one thing but I waited for 20 minutes for fries and got sliders both times with onions.  Didn't ask for onions !!! Twice !! Definitely don't recommend this place to any due the fact of piss poor service. It's fucking freezing in there and you can't here what the person next to you is saying because the music is so incredibly loud. Good luck to anyone who goes here! You'll need it! XD place is shit.

We went there and waiting for an hour. Their hostesses keep telling us table will be ready soon. People we came in same time already finished and left. We end up eating somewhere else. Their service is horrible, will never go back again

Come for Happy Hour. The staff here are very nice and welcoming. From the moment we enter to the time we leave. Our drinks never hit 50% and the manager also walks by to make sure everythings up to par. Such a great place to hangout. It feels like your at home with a bunch of friends and ur neighbors are bringing you food. Music, food, drinks, excitement inside TGI.
If i could give zero stars i would, last night ate this for dinner & i have severe food poisoning!..never again!

Waiters/waitresses are always rude, and have ugly attitudes. The appetizers made my stomach hurt last time I came. Better off going to the T.G.I.F is west covina.
My rating is for the slow service. The food was okay. Had to wait 20mins before getting my drink i had to remind the waiter.

It's good to have a TGIF so close to El Monte, I used to drive out to Covina...there is plenty of parking and it's conveniently next to the 10 freeway. This particular location is fairly new so it is very clean and modern. The staff has always been courteous and well attending...there is a good amount of TVs to watch the games wether you sit at the bar or at a table. Not a bad place to meet up with friends on a Friday for food and drinks.
They have amazing samplers dish. Everything was amazing, except the baby rib portion.  If you like domestic draught then TGIF is the place to go to during their happy hour, $4 for 20oz.

Worst service ever. Can't tell if it was bad service or just a bad server. Our server only came one time to check up on us. Had a mediocre meal that we payed too much for. The fish ended up giving me a stomach ache but the steak was okay at best. What really made me write this review was the waitress. Service was terrible! Our server did not know what she was doing. Worst service ever.... And beware of the water... It taste like toilet water. GROSS!

I always get a different experience every time I visit TGIF.  I want to like this place more, I really do.... Service:  It's the only decent new american restaurant/bar near me so I was hoping to make this place a regular.  Unfortunately, every time we sit at the bar area, the service is so slow.  We're sitting there sobering up as we try to flag down our server for another drink.  Maybe it's because we look younger then the normal crowd (30s-45s).  I experienced our server chatting way too long with other customers instead of helping us out. Food:  Living in 626, you are used to eating very good food.  TGIF is just average.  We did like the appetizers we had there, especially their fried string beans with wasabi sauce.  Here was what we tried Fried String beans: Good! Boneless buffalo wings: pass Flat bread: O.K.  Mozzarella sticks: Good! but eat them right when you get them.  Spinach Dip: Too thick, hard to scoop with thin chips.  Also, I would avoid of their meats unless you are ordering their ribs.  Their meats are dry and overcooked.

Just came with a group of 13 people, and service is extremely slow. It took over an hour for 2 or 3 of our group members to get appetizers. Drinks took 15 or 20 minutes to come. Its ridiculous. One of our group members ordered a salad which shpuld not have takened that long.  I talked to a waitor then the manager, and the reason was because it was busy and  they tried accomadating to us and refilling our drinks as quickly as possible . This is a tuesday night and it was not that full. This will be our first and last time coming here. Ive seen places at full capacities do better. When the food came other group members were not satisfied. I came right when my friends ordered but seeing that it took so long I did not want to order anything but a drink. Two stars is for not charging gratuity.

Overall I really like Fridays but this one in particular isn't really that great to be honest. So needless to say I was very disappointed. The quality of the food (how well it was cooked and how good it tasted) was not worth what we paid for it,  AT ALL.

TGIF is a typical American chain, but what I like about it is their Happy Hour --which this review is for. This location is also close to my house, so it's a quick option to grab a drink. The bar area gets pretty crowded, so it's usually tough grabbing a seat especially during a game. For draft beer ($3) and well drinks ($4) along with specialty drinks ($5/6) is such a great deal for HH. Of course there's also their half off appetizers and I've enjoyed those. I most recently had the potato skins ($4.50), which come totally loaded with bacon and cheese. It's a great place to catch up with friends or watch the game.

Doesn't even deserve a star! Went in on Father's Day at 9:40 and wasn't even a busy night and it took 25 minutes to get a drink and 45 minutes to order! And we never even saw our server at all, everything was brought out to us by the manager and everyone in our table had no drinks for 15 minutes and manager came again to get us more drinks supposedly and never came back with our drinks, we were in there for an hour and 30 minutes and never saw our server and never received our food. Worst experience ever

Went for a quick lunch with my family. Our waiter Ricardo was really nice but couldn't get our order correct! We just ordered appetizers and it took such a long time to get them. We had s sweet waitress that was very patient with us... Very clean and a great atmosphere. The steaks were very delicious and the mashed potatoes were yummy. Bonus was the Instagram sign the girls held up for my son to take a pic in... All around a good time!

horrible servers and it they mess up all of our orders which were very simple and easy to get down there. by the way don not get chris at all o r your food is cold because he was sitting in the back playing on his phone
Me and my gf are super fans here, Bartenders here are so nice to us, make extra strong alcohol to us all the time.  9pm to close is happy hours, $5 drinks, come juoin us!

The best Friday's I've been too definitely made up for the last bad experience at the last Friday the mixologist Martin was the best!!! He's great at his job and the rest of the staff  were very attentive and had a great attitude!!! Everything was perfect!!! Im really glad that I gave fridays a second shot

Love, love, love this location! Ask for Ricardo, he is the best server! We've been his regulars for awhile now but I've been a bit absentee lately. Went in tonight with my best friend, and Ricardo asked how things have been. I explained that I got a new job so I've been busy. He was super excited for me and asked me all about it. The surprise came at the end of the meal when we discovered that he had paid for our food as a Congratulations to me on my new job! That is awesome service! Thank you Ricardo!!!!

Fun,friendly atmosphere. Great food. They are very accommodating. The Jack Daniels chicken is good. The bar does get packed so finding a table there can be hard sometimes. Get there early.....if you want a table in the bar for your party.

Got the 2 for $20 last night during happy hour. I already love the look and feel of the place. The food was good and the service was excellent. Our waiter was fast, polite, funny and suggestive. It was a great experience, we'll be returning for sure.
I love this restaurant .  The environment is great !!!  Our server William is always the best !! The food is always delicious !!

I'm never disappointed when I come here to eat. The servers are really nice and very courteous. They're always coming to the table to check up on us to see if we need anything else (I know they do that everywhere, but they really make sure that you're satisfied here). I actually celebrated my 26th birthday here and they gave me a Tennessee whiskey cake for free. It was really rich and delicious! We'll come back again for more amazing food and excellent customer service.

To be honest I am really a harsh critic when it comes to food and drinks and honestly I drive from downtown LA every week just to come to this Friday's I've at least done it 15 times in a row! The food I order is excellent and it's from the bar and it's the bones less buffalo wings, crispy potato skins and mozzarella sticks with an electric lemonade extra cherries! This is the best Friday's in all of California and I've been to several! They deliver every single time with their food quality and their drinks if you go ask for Martin as he is our fav bartender. Hope he stays there forever! Hats off to the Rosemead Friday's for being the reason I can't lose these last 10lbs I need shake lol

This place is the bomb!!!!! Service at the bar is great! Martin the bar tender always makes great drinks, his electric lemonade is the bizzzzzz!!!  The rest of the staff always makes sure we are taken care of and the buffalo boneless wings, potato skins and mozzarella sticks are just incredibly fresh all the time!  Make sure you go there and it's super cheap during happy hr!

Worst service ever, we had to sit and wait for a very long time for our food. I would understand if the restaurant was full of guest and busy but it was very empty. We order two very expensive appetizers and didn't even get small plates to eat, plus the food was very cold and super greasy. We order two desserts and the cake was old and dry. Took my daughter to eat here yesterday, it was buzzing, lots of people there, found out that they offer Happy Hour and so they know how to get people there though the week! We were quickly seated in a booth, the service was good, not great but good.  The appetizers came after a bowl of clam chowder I ordered which was odd but Okay, not a big deal.  Food was Okay, not the best but certainly not bad. I would say that my over-all experience was a good one, I will return with the wife next time.

The endless appetizers for $12 per person is great but it's good for lunch, our server Adela is fast and very good. This is my first time here, I ordered the sirloin and Mac and cheese. OMG the management came out and comped the dessert will be coming back, great location.

I've specifically stated no cheese and no cream both times I ordered this salad. I made sure to repeat it multiple times the second time I went. Of course, I still received the salad with cheese AND cream both times. I never like to complain when it's things I can fix, so I scraped out as much cheese and cream (eating around it too) as I could. I didn't get a full meal because the cheese pieces were too small to dig out. The iced tea and drinks were good though.
The bad reviews are true. Try an Applebee's instead.
waitress was nice, although she was gone for long periods of time and we kept wondering where she disappeared to. The food was okay. My flat bread was hard like crackers and my chicken was cold.

Flat breads aren't supposed to crunch like crackers.  I had water, first glass was perfect tasting water. The next cup tasted like it was straight from the tap. I recommend coming here only during happy hour because the more buzzed you are, the more likely you will overlook the negatives.
The food is amazing and the servers are always there to help you have a great experience. Happy Hour is phenomenal and the people are super friendly
Food was great but service at the bar was very very slow. My girlfriend and I had to resort to using another bartender, and had to ask for water refills and other pretty basic items.
Great place to go after work and enjoy some food where their kitchen is open late. Service is good.

Love the place! My partner and I always enjoy our visits to this location. Friendly staff and fast service. Happy hour here is great!
