She was super nice, attentive and made sure that our food was brought out as quickly as possible. We had also mentioned to her that we had just drove from a different location in City of Industry where we had just received maybe the worst service ever. Adela apologized for the service from the other location we were coming from even though she could have just turned a cold shoulder. She made sure we were well taken care of the whole night.  This location is a little further out for us coming from the DTLA area but it has never disappointed. The staff here is A+++ with great friendly service regardless of the party size.  Just wanted to give Adela another call out for turning our horrible night into an enjoyable night out with the fam.  Thank you management for staffing a great team of employees at this location.

This place is... I would say terrible, but the customer service was well.. The restaurant is clean, but the food, the quality, the quantity was terrible. I paid 24$ for a steak the size of my palm, lobster tails that were like shrimp and sweet potatoe fries that were not appetizing. The mash potatoes were okay. My partner did not enjoy her pasta and it was way too oily. I thought she was just talking about the sauce, but in the end I decided to have a little bit of her pasta and holy, you literally can see the orange oil in the pasta. We ordered my entree, two drinks, and the oily pasta. It all added up to 50$!... Too expensive and I was still not full even after eating mines and some of the pasta.  I don't normally post reviews, but this place was so bad I had to. It was also my first time here. I won't be coming.. Ever. My server Kevin was extremely nice and made us feel appreciated. Other then that, it was bad.
Was not happy at all came in and order a sizzling chicken and shrimp and salad never got my salad never received my shrimp  the manager service never come back again

Busy on Friday nights! Came for HH for the Dodgers game. Weekday HH ends at 7 pm. Prices for HH and menu food went up. 20 oz - $4 - PBR, went up 50 cents. Spinach Flatbread -$4.50 - went up 35 cents. Wings - $5.50 - went up 50 cents. They do not have scorching sauce anymore. The ghost pepper sauce is better. Sriracha sauce is ok.  Slider - $1.50 - Same price as before. Grilled onions and cheese! Cheaper if you buy 3 of these vs the sliders from the appetizer menu.

I don't think I would going back here again. I was seated it. I was with my brother last night we order rare steak instead we got medium rare. The server gotten us new steak I got 10 ounce and my little brother seem like it got smaller. I didn't get refill on my drinks until I had to ask him last. The service and food quality was really bad last and the grande nacho was also bad. We so tired last night so we didn't file a complaint.

thanks for helping with the fundraiser at savannah memorial park pioneer cemetery 1st spooky movie night.  your certificates were very much appreciated by us and those raffle winners.  michelle, volunteer at smp

Perfection at this price point is unreasonable. The true differentiator is response to error. In that capacity Gina the manager rules her roost. A true pro. Great HH and lots of TVs if you are into that sort of thing.

The service is nice. If joined into their club you can get free chips with salsa. With points added up you can get a lot of different things.   There is also an extra card for lunch. Every time you go to lunch you can get a punched hole on the card. After 5 holes you can have a free lunch.
Happy hour half off appetizers ..woohoo..but what is up with rhe lollicup style chicken strips?

Came on a Sunday night for one of our friend's birthday dinner. We had a party of 10 people. Food and deals were obviously good quality. Other than that customer service is horrible. First of all, we weren't even greeted when we entered. The host/greeter didn't seem enthusiastic/friendly at all. And for the worst part our waiter was very unattentive, he took forever to attend us, to come check up on us and finally for our checks he took over 30 minutes to come to our table to get our payment. Horrible experience on a Sunday night when we all have to go home and prepare for our week. Such an inconvenience. We came here at 8 and didn't end up leaving until 11 :( . I won't recommend this place to anyone.
This is a nice little spot with a killer Long Island . The steak and lobster was cook to perfection .

Chill spot to go and great place to end the evening and meet up with friends. Kareoke tuesdays starts at 10pm and it always turns up! Great vibe and chill ppl. The bar is usually busy but also a good place to meet new ppl.
First time in rosemead, order rib eye and lobster. Steak was good. So was baby back ribs. Lobster however was so burnt and dry. The meat won't get separated from the shell.... overall ...soso...

Waiter had to be new....and working in bar area...not cool.  First he was scared when he talked to us.  2nd he had hard time hearing us. 3rd I ordered a shot of fireball while I still had half of a beer and he told me he couldn't serve me it until I was finished with my beer!  WTF are you serious bro?  Ok I think that is a law but really there were people all over the bar shooting and drinking at the same time.  So very very dumb.

Typical TGI Friday's. Good happy hour specials, especially on appetizers.  Love their potato skins and spinach dip. Never get sick of it.  A tip to the management though: Turn down the AC because it's freezing in there.

Went inside without expecting much from this place, and I was right. All the foods were over priced, though having a nice selection of appetizers that were half off. Though the food may not be the best, the service was great! I ordered a serving of fish and chips and it came out with three slices of fish. The taste was alright, though the batter wasn't evenly spread out. I'd give the fish 3.5 stars for the taste. Though when moved on to my second piece of fish, it was under cooked so I had them take it back. They gave me complementary clam chowder and remade the entire dish free of charge. It was nice of them. Though it might have not been the best, it's definitely not the worst. Id go back some day maybe just to eat purely appetizers. GET THE SPINACH DIP!

Sat in the bar at 8:30pm on a Tuesday. I could tell immediately the service was slow. Let's just say a Roomba with a serving tray would have been better than our server. Our drinks took almost 10 minutes, and our server was dropping things off like plates and such and just walking away without saying anything. At least a "I'll be right back to take your order" or "do you need a couple more minutes" or "do you have any questions?", would have been nice. After she dropped off our drinks, she was about to leave without saying anything again, until I said "Can I order?". To which she said, let me drop off some drinks first. Bad. Plain bad. I ordered the Ahi Cobb and buffalo wings. The Ahi was fishy, gross and the salad did not come with extra egg or bacon like i had asked. The wings were good. When the service is as bad as it was it brings the experience down a notch. I ended up leaving a 15% tip. I later thought that was too generous. Sorry not sorry.

I've been here only once and this review is specifically for their endless appetizers. Seriously, it's a fatty's heaven! For around 12 bucks, you can stuff your face with all the fried goodness until you pass out. The options include: fried green beans, spinach dip, boneless wings, mozzarella sticks, bbq chicken flatbread, potato skins and potstickers.  We only got to try the boneless wings, potstickers, mozzarella sticks, potato skins and the fried green beans. It was so much food. We didn't even finish our food. I think all that fried goodness just filled me up. The food was actually good. I would come back, maybe not get the endless appetizers, but to try out their other food.  The service was great. Our waiter checked up on us regularly and ordered our appetizers as soon as one order came to our table.

Not a bad place to come during Happy Hour. Friendly bartenders and good discounts. $6 Ultimate Long Island Teas, Ultimate Electric Lemonades, Ultimate Margaritas. During Monday Happy Hour from 9pm to closing time, they also have $4 House Margaritas. In addition, I quite enjoyed the Appletini that I ordered. One of the appetizers, the loaded potato skins, looked particularly interesting, but I wasn't hungry enough to try it. Until next time TGIF!

My boyfriend and I came out to California from Las Vegas for 2 days for an event, and we decided to stop by TGIF for dinner and drinks. That was probably a mistake.  We were smiling and friendly when we came through the door, but we were not greeted this way from our two hostess. It was strange because the hostess didn't seem like they knew what they were doing. We were finally sat after an awkward conversation involving how many people we had in our party.  We were not impressed by the service. We had a total of 3 different waiters before our food was on our table. The servers were informing us they were leaving because of how slow it is was, and I understand that. I too work in food and beverage, and I have worked in this industry for several years so I understand completely. What I don't understand is the reason why we kept getting servers that were transferring tabs to each other, but they were leaving as well. With that being said our waitresses really didn't check on us. It wasn't busy, so where was our 3rd waiter? The food was delicious! I ordered the ribs and my boyfriend ordered a burger. The mashed potato side for my dinner came with cheese on top; I can't have cheese. I asked our 2nd and 3rd servers about it, and they told me they would bring me out a separate side dish of mashed potatoes. My mashed potatoes came out and they were hot and amazing! It all tasted magnificent! Kudos to the chef(s)!  I asked our 1st waitress what she recommended on alcoholic beverages, and she was having a hard time figuring out what the drink was called and what was in it. =\ I ordered what she recommended and it tasted great but, I was expecting a bit of a buzz. I hadn't had food all day, and I drank my entire drink before my food and I felt nothing. I wasted some money, but at least I tried it. It was quite easy to pay for our food, but that seems like that's always the case in restaurants. Haha. We payed through the tablet that's placed on all of the tables. It also included a percentage on tipping, if you would like to tip. Nice touch. Of course we tipped, but we weren't sure WHO to tip and WHO the tip went to.  We also noticed the hostess at the front door was holding the door open for people exiting and entering the establishment. I mentioned before we left, "If they don't hold the door open for us, then something isn't right here." And low and behold as we were walking out, the hostess didn't hold the door open for us.  This will probably be the first and last time we come here for dinner and drinks when traveling to Rosemead.

Me and a friend walked in, and was greeted warmly by two hostesses. However, after she sat us down, and said that our server would be right with us, nobody came to help us at all. It wasn't until another server noticed us looking around and waiting to ask us if we were okay, and we told her that we haven't been helped yet. She said she would find our server, and she did. I believe his name was Michael and said that the other server had left and he didn't know that we were under his service, which was understandable. However, what wasn't acceptable was the fact that he barely gave us any attention at all. We were seated near the kitchen and my friend and I had both noticed our food had came out already. He and I watched as our server walked in and out of the kitchen, occasionally chit chatting with another server. Later, after he saw us, he then said, let me check on your food. He went in and finally got us our food. However once we had finally looked at our food, we realized he messed up our order. Towards the end when we were paying, that's when he started giving us more attention. Not coming back to this place again, and telling everyone else to stay away also.

Never come here again.  They have kids handle customers and they are ruded and unorganized.  We have a family of seven and when ask for plates, they gave us five plates.  Our server is awesome.  Kudo to her.  Food is not great at all.  Less amount of food for the same price as Olive's Garden.  My first and last time at TGIF.

Honestly, if it weren't for the amazing happy hour, I wouldn't be visiting much.  That said, do not come for dinner with friends or a family dinner or a "treat".. because you'll be disappointed!  Service is pretty bad and the food is just okay.. but their HAPPY HOUR is so good :D Come for their happy hour, which is all day sundays and almost everyday from 3-7 and late night.  Call ahead to double check.  They have half off appetizers, meaning all their appetizers are around $5.  They also have discounted drinks and $6 Margaritas... $1.50 fries and sliders.. amongst other things. here are my FAVE HAPPY HOUR items (all around $5): - traditional wings with jack daniels sauce.. you get 10 wings, and their jack daniels sauce is BOMB - potato wedges.. they're deep fried.. and so yummy.  but beware if you are not a fan of super duper fried food.  there's hardly any potato - jack daniels chicken.. again, their jack daniels sauce is AMAZING with anything and everything - spinach dip.. i get this when i crave it.  but obviously it's not as good as CPK or woodranch... the cheese tastes cheap and it sorta tastes like it came out of a can - bbq chicken flatbread.. tastes like what it sounds like - frozen margarita... pomegranate, you can taste the alcohol the most.  mango is the sweetest (least alcohol tasting) i would skip on green bean fries, their nacho dips, and other things.. yeaaa.. i've tried just about all their appetizers here multiple times lol OH and get their free stripes card to get free chips and salsa everytime you go!  and fill out their survey on the receipt to get $8 off!!

I went in about 4pm on a Friday.  The service was horrible the moment my friends and I walked in. There was no hostess to greet us, or the customers before me. The hostess had us wait while she cleaned off the table. Then our waitress was avoiding eye contact. We had to call her over for everything!!!!  We got our appetizers before our drinks. We had to ask after eating half the appetizer for our drinks.  All of our drinks were weak.  We never got our waters we asked for twice.  She didn't come back with the to-go boxes for our left overs.  I've given this place three chances and they failed majorly each time.

Went here for lunch with one of my business clients. It is kind of weird coming here for lunch cause this is usually a night scene. I got the smoke house burger which i enjoyed. Service was great. Kept checking in on us. Crab Cakes were mediocre and the steaks look good as well. Come here for happy hour for $6 cocktails and $3 beer.s

Friday night. 4 pm. Got a table in bar. Couple of beers. Then it went all downhill.  Not only was the service bad, we were getting dirty looks from the red headed bartender. A few people met us after we first arrived, and it took them 30 min to get a Modelo Bottle and a Root Beer. Manager called and she didn't seem to care. Would never come back here. I'm actually still sitting here and decided it was that bad that it was necessary to review it while sitting here.

Waited an hour for our take out and they forgot one order. First of all they thought we got our food and we were waiting the whole time. Then they missed one of the orders. NEVER order take out. Another guy ahead of us also had an issue with his takeout...that was a sign!
Best TGIF need town. Happy hour all day Sunday, can't asks for more. Service here is great!!!

The first time that's I have come here without having to send a plate back. Your lucky if you have Priscilla as your server. Came in around 11pm and had a little bit of a wait but it didn't take very long. Our server Priscilla was very polite and attentive. I have come here a couple other times during the day and always had something ordered and cooked incorrectly. This was refreshing.

Was given a time estimate of a hour for dinner on a Sunday night.  After about 10 minutes or so of waiting we just decided to just sit at the bar area.  I was actually expecting to get close to no service since we were sitting in that area but our server was really prompt.  We were able to order drinks and appetizers almost right away. There was a good amount of us so we were able to try many different things.  The food came our extremely fast, but sadly the food is mediocre at best.  My favorite was the buffalo wings, not overcooked and the sauce was tangy and had the right amount of spice. There was a small confusing with one of our orders though.  One of the food runners thought our green beans were mozzarella sticks so we didn't take it.  After about 10 minutes we were wondering where our green beans were.  After we told our server he brought them out immediately and told us the confusion.  They probably sat out for those 10 minutes but oh well. I'd only come for half priced appetizers during happy hour.  Food quality does not match pricing, but service was better than I thought it would be.

My first and only time I would ever come back here.. Is for their happy hour from 4pm-7pm. And to be honest.. Happy hour isn't all that great though. Drink selections were super limited.. Domestic draught beers were $3.50ish && you only get to pick from TWO selections (Either bud light OR coors light). Their mixed drinks were roughly $6 && you get to pick from THREE options that were pretty weak in alcohol content... Bleh. Appetizers are half off which is greaaat though. I ordered the spinach cheese dip for $5 and I surprisingly enjoyed it a lot. My BF ordered their "stacked burger" that came with fries and TBH this burger was so basic for $13 (not worth it). The fries were super dry too.  SOOOOO... IN CONCLUSION... This place is only worth coming to if you're NOT hungry & will settle for appetizers & drinks during happy hour.

1, Inattentive waiter we had to keep flagging him down to ask for things, not once did he bother to see if everything was OK on his own and the place was almost empty. 2, Food sucked it was not good at all Wife ordered the steak and lobster special and got an overcooked steak ( she ordered medium ) and the vegetables had a funky taste. I ordered the french dip and the fries were overcooked  I won't bother coming back and wasting my money, some of the staff is rude and the food isn't even good

I came with family on a Sunday. I generally like going to this restaurant. This was our first visit to this location. Utensils were dirty. The pretzel stick was burnt on the outside and frozen on the inside. My daughter ordered fish and steak. The plate had so much 'water' in it compromising the flavor of the fish. The worst part was the music. It was so loud even the server couldn't hear us when we were placing the order. The only reason I am giving this restaurant three stars is because the server was very nice.

I always go to this Friday's because of their great atmosphere. The service is excellent, and the food comes quick. The waiters are always friendly, and make sure that you don't need anything else. They always come to our table to make sure our drinks were topped off. Will go again.

Food wasn't that great even for happy hour prices.   Probably won't go back.  Tuesdays can be pretty loud.  Last night two guys were singing karaoke and I couldn't even hear my friend talk and we were sitting at the bar just inches from each other.  I tried the wings, tuna, fries, and all were pretty bad.  Margaritas tastes good but we had three to 4 drinks each and couldn't get a buzz so I think they didn't really put much alcohol in it.  I'll probably go back to BJ's instead.

Horrible service! Our waiters name was Chris and he seemed like he was over his job. Never came to check up on us, never asked if we wanted desert(which we were planning on getting), instead of offering us desert he left the check and left. Taking my business elsewhere and NEVER returning here. Horrible way to spend a friends 21st birthday.  At least we got some type good service from the host while seating us.

Enjoying a good time. Can't go wrong with endless apps.  Pack always on Friday. Kind of have to wait a bet. But over all I enjoy the endless all. The happy hour. Nice place to go if you want to get away by still want to go your average American theme restaurants.

I came here after work with my co workers and received really great service from Priscilla!  She was so sweet and patient with my large party and I. She went over the menu with us, brought out all of our drinks in a timely manner, and even made sure to check up on us and our drinks regularly.  I ordered the baby back ribs and shrimp entree with a side of coleslaw. The meat was tender and fell right off the bone. The BBQ sauce was flavorful and tangy. I also ordered a side of Jack Daniels BBQ wings. It was a bit on the sweet side, but still tasted good!  I'll definitely be coming back after work with my co workers! Thanks Priscilla!

Really bad customer service , the server was chit chatting away like he was getting paid to talk to his co workers if there was negative stars I would definitely give this place that . I asked for dessert and he didn't even get me that . Very terrible customer service this is the last time I come here the salmon was dry . The server didn't even get me a fork or knife to cut my stake with , till after my boyfriend had to ask like what was I suppose to cut my food with my nail? Really bad service . We asked for the check and he brought it and then just left without coming back for it . When he finally did come back I gave him big zeros on the tip spot

I love this TGIF mainly because it is nice and spacious. The manager Gina is has always greeted us. I love that she cares for the customers and looks like she cares for her staff as well.   The shrimp is great, love me a pomegranate Margarita, however; the chicken was a bit dry. Second time at this location and so far nothing but good times.

It was pretty dead we sat and our waitress was rude and rushing us. I got a burger and they brought me the wrong one!!! Then it took 25 min for the correct one to be sent. My wife got chicken and spinach with no flavor. My nephew got a beef dip and it tasted old

Wish I could give minus stars!!!! First of all we walk in and the hostess had her back turned on her headset talking for a good 5 minutes!!! Finally another girl came up and walked us to our table. I told the girl the hostess didn't even ask if we wanted a table or booth, she then replied sorry(with an attitude) The waiter was very nice but over worked. I had to send my salad back twice. The food was ok. We saw the manager (woman) running around in her damn headset but never once asked how people were doing. Horrible!!! She needs to be fired as well as the hostess. Get it together...

I always receive amazing service when I dine at TGI Fridays, but today, the service was above and beyond! As soon as we were seated, we were asked what we wanted to drink by the host. After we received our drinks, the waiter came and asked if we wanted any appetizers, which we did. We ordered the $10 unlimited mozzarella sticks and ordered our meal as well: the memphis rubbed ribs. The mozzarella sticks came out within minutes and the memphis rubbed ribs came out shortly after. The food was great! Mozzarella sticks were fresh and hot as well the memphis rubbed ribs. The waiter was attentive: he kept checking up on us and did not let us run out of mozzarella sticks until we said the word, which was great! We ended the visit with happy stomachs and no complaints, only compliments to the waiter and chef/staff.

One of my favorite restaurants to eat at but when I went here my experience was horrible. So I go on a weekday at night(I don't remember the exact day) but it was a weekday and I remember the bar was having this (mini party) with all the music and the host being very interactive with the crowd, and people were dancing and drinking with one another, so the waitress was very distracted by this and while I was trying to order my food and ask her about side dishes etc. I caught her many times not paying attention and being distracted by the event at the bar, which meant she wasn't doing her job or applying herself. That was one of the first things that I disliked, second she never really checked up on how I was doing with refills or if I needed anything, third I had to order some other side dish that I normally do not get because their deep fryer was not working. Fourth I usually get the jack Daniels ribs and at every other TGIF I go to they glaze the ribs with the sauce and here they did not, so they didn't have as much flavor as they usually do. All in all it was a bad experience here at this location. Horrible service from the waitress and bad experience/luck with the food.
If you work all day and go to tgif for A GREAT COLD BEER, forget it . By time they get around to bringing your beer it's flat and warm. Very slow bar service.

I've been here several times since it opened and I've yet to have a bad experience.  The staff is kind and patient. The food is phenomenal as always. I feel like I get my money's worth here for what I end up paying.

I come to this location often, and the food and service is usually very good. Lately though, it's been declining, and i have a feeling tonight was the last time ill be coming here. I'm fed up with giving this place chances, honestly. The servers are still very nice, but the food and management need serious improvement.  Apparently chicken flatbread pizza is too hard for the cooks to get right. Messed up my first order, pizza had no onions or cilantro.  Second time around the chicken on the pizza was still frozen. Biting into undercooked pizza with frozen chicken is disgusting btw. Then complaining to the manager salvidor helped in no way.  I was told to tell him if anything else went wrong and it did, but of course nothing was done to fix it except an "im  sorry" an the same rehearsed "come to me for problems" thing and no actions. (I've had issues the last several times I've come, and this is the same manager I've spoken to, who of course, had the same thing to say, with no help whatsoever.) Out of sending pizzas back 5 TIMES! Only one was edible. The others were burnt, missing toppings, or undercooked. My companions were all done eating before i even got to eat. Honestly i am leaving frustrated and unsatisfied,  so i will not be back. Tgif, i really suggest you put better managers who know how to help customers and run a smoother operation. And better trained cooks.
I am a regular here lol. Their unlimited appetizers are super worth it, especially if you are a big eater like me! Their drinks are also pretty good. :)

I'm a regular here lol. The main reason I come here is for the endless appetizers for $12. Love love it!!!! The chicken wings, tostadas, mozzarella sticks, spinach dip,  etc... Yum yum in my tum tum. One of the other things I have tried is the steak and lobster for 15.99 Monday to Friday from 3-6pm. The way they cook your steak varies (in a group of 4, 1 came out medium rare as requested and 1 came out rare as requested - other 2 were not medium and rare as requested). Luckily, mine came out rare and was delicious. The lobster tail I didn't care for, it was somewhat bitter and hard to get its shell off.  The waiters are super nice and I'm starting to recognize some of them... that sounds like a problem haha.  Overall, I would come back mostly for the endless appetizers. It's worth it for me and makes me happy!

My wife and I came her to have dinner. It was a twenty minute wait but we found a bar top in the bar area to have a drink and some food. Our waitress was friendly and had good suggestions when we asked about things on the menu. We placed our drink order and some appetizers. For appetizers we had Sriracha buffalo wings.  Sriracha wings - they we ok. No difference from regular wings. They did say there was an extra little kick but really didn't get the kick. We also asked the person who brought our wings out for some blue cheese and that took forever. We had to ask another waitress to get it. I was expecting something different it they taste like basic buffalo wings.  For our main course my wife ordered the Cobb salad and I had there 10 oz new your steak medium rare.  Cobb salad - very disappointing and to be hones it looked like an incomplete said. In the words of my wife "what a sad salad". It looked like a bunch of lettuce and not much of anything else. I told my wife to ask for extras to add to that salad but she didn't want to.  NY steak - was not how it was described. The steak was described as. Ewing cooked with spices and topped with a type of butter. Well let me tell you it was nothing like that. I think they have me the wrong steak. It was cooked medium rare how I wanted it but had a sweet glaze over it like when you order a jack Daniels stake that they advertise but that's not what I ordered nor wanted, But I didn't complain and ate it anyways.  I do have to say when we got the dressing for our buffalo wings my wife dipped her wing and took a bite of the wing ending up with a piece of plastic in her mouth. We believe it was from the bag they cut open to get some blue cheese dressing. We brought it up to the waitress and she got the manager. The manager was very nice and gave us a discount and a free dessert. We were just trying to bring it up to their attention to be careful next time. We appreciate what the manager did for us but the cooks should be a little more careful.  Would we go back? Maybe for drinks not sure about the food.

I'm not one to write review but to wait 35 minutes for a drink is unacceptable! We sat for 15 min without being acknowledged, one of us got up to tell the host we have yet to be greeted. The host, who appeared to be an older lady, possibly the manager she had the swipe key asked where are you seated, mind you she sat us. Really you're asking where we are seated?  Irritated my response was, "in the back corner where you sat us". Three minutes later, she then asked us if she could get us to drink. We gave her our entire order. Fifteen minutes later our appetizer comes out, yet NO DRINKS!!! Im parched and feeling dehydrated at this point. Ok, maybe not the dehydrated part but really, 35 minutes for drinks . The appetizer were the only good thing. Our food was warm, not hot. It was almost as if it had sat under the light in the kitchen. I've worked at restaurants for years and even when it's jammed packed I've always acknowledge guests as quickly as I could. The worst part is, it was not busy where one could justify the lack of attention. There is absolutely no communication amongst the lady who sat us, later took our order and the gentleman who was suppose to be our server. Once we had submitted our order, 2 different servers now decide to come ask us if they can take our order. Yes, we left a tip but it was not deserved. This restaurant needs attention to its guests !!!

Love this place ! Happy hour all Sunday, every Sunday of the year ! Salvador provides great service as well as the bartenders Martin, Raul and Corey! Ask for them at the bar @ all the times , they  will take care of you !!
Terrible service in the bar. Music too loud. Food was good. Liked the happy hour specials.

Came to this location at 12:15 and the food was terrible ! This  is the worst tgif I've  ever been to.  The one in the  eastland center is much better. Food was cold and didn't  look fresh at all will never ever come back to this  location at all.

Came here with my friend and all I can say is come here for their happy hour from 3pm till 7pm I believe or their 14.99 steak and lobster tail deal from 3pm till 6pm! Gotta love their happy hour come by and try it
Walked out after not getting served...got impatient with server..took long to get drinks....after waiting impatiently to place food order...we walked out
Hosts here are sooo unprofessional. Seriously, don't know how to handle a busy evening. Avoid this location!!

Been sitting here with a dirty plate and an empty beer and neither of the two bartenders have come up to me. It's Tuesday night and it's not even busy. Not the greatest service in the world, won't be coming back to this one if these guys are still working here.
Came here for drinks on a weekend night.  Long island and black berry mojito. Friendly bartenders, not too crowded.

Sitting and eating with my girlfriend, I ordered a burger, she got the chicken sizzler, and my food came first. Well I eat like a freaking Savage and when the manager saw I was done and my girlfriend's food hadn't gotten to us yet she went way out of the way to make sure our experience was satisfactory. I'll return just because of her service, absolutely above expectations.

Our waitress, Priscilla was PHENOMENAL, always checking up on us and making sure we were good, and everything was, until we asked her, AFTER the Raiders game was over, to put the Kings game on one of the main bar TV's that was more visible to us and to play the audio from the Kings game. She went to ask and came back to inform us that unfortunately the manager wouldn't do it. I asked to speak with him. He came by our table and after i asked him again he said "yeah, that's not gonna happen." I was astonished, paying customers cant have the audio from a live sports game? Is it the bartenders decision or is it only if more people request to hear the game? Next time, if someone makes a request, take care of the customer. He needs to be removed from his position, given some customer service training, and re-interviewed to see if he truly qualifies for this job.
